Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: courtaf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eiffel-Kennedy Hotel for 3 nights via a Eurostar train-hotel package. The room was small, but clean and very nice, with a recently renovated bathroom that was a nice surprise. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Our bed was a bit uncomfortable, since it sagged in the middle, and the pillows were hard and lumpy, but linens were clean and changed daily. It's important to note that the hotel is located in a quiet residential area, a bit far from the main tourist and more lively areas. However, the hotel is a less than 5-minute walk from an RER (train) station, and the particular train line that services this station goes along the Sienne River so it is very easy to get to the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, Louvre, etc.

Reviews.Title: “friendly hotel in quiet area - small rooms though”
Reviews.Author: Richard271
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week end. Good Points: + Friendly staff + Nice breakfast + In quiet area + Can (just) see the Eiffel tower from the room Bad: - Room was fairly small (this is Paris though) - Location: quiet yes, but it was a bit of a trek into the city. You can walk to the Eiffel tower in about 20-30 mins, but getting into the city to see the other sights was a bit of a chore. Would i go back? No, but only because i'd rather stay somewhere more central

Reviews.Title: “'A Little Gem'”
Reviews.Author: noobutler
Reviews.Content: A fantastic & friendly hotel. The receptionist could not have been more helpful when we arrived. She recommended a fantastic restaurant called 'Le B' & booked a table for us...would highly recommend. The rooms were immaculate & the beds were incredibly comfortable Breakfast was amazing & wouldn't have wanted to eat any where else! We cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel and great value”
Reviews.Author: Wes_Charles
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this lovely hotel and there were a number of things which stood out for me. Firstly, all the staff were incredibly friendly, even the night porters, and were happy to advise on ideas of things to do. The room was quite small, but bigger than some rooms I've had in Paris, and you don't get big rooms here really. The bed was incredibly comfortable - two single mattresses with a double duvet and sheets with nice soft pillows. The bathroom was immaculate and a good size. Breakfast was in the basement and for 10 euros I was surprised at the choice, with quiches, cakes, cold meats and cheeses, croissants, juice, cereal, etc. The location was a little out of the way, but the area itself is interesting, with a good Monet gallery just up the road.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel, Peaceful Neighborhood, Warm Staff”
Reviews.Author: diplomatourist
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the morning and the front desk staff didn't make a fuss about checking us in early (9AM) without extra charge. The rooms were very compact, but still adequate for two (Asian) travelers with one luggage each. Taller and more un-light travelers may find it too tight. The bathroom was clean, the lobby was charming, the staff were very friendly, helpful and always ready to extend assistance. The breakfast place at the cellar was quite unique and their few but quality breakfast buffet items of quiche, fresh fruits, caramel flan, breads and cheeses never disappoint. The location is in a quiet residential neighborhood, and walking to the train stations add to your delightful Parisian experience.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Geek2Go
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel in a good location. It is not great, but more than satisfying. The room was small, as we have come to expect in Europe, but adequate. The bed was a bit narrow for two people, and my only real complaint was that the mattress seemed to sag into the middle. Mind you, we were so tired from enjoying Paris each day that we barely noticed. The location is a short walk from the Eiffel tower along the river. If you are lucky and crane your neck, you might see the tower from your room. We ended up sitting by the river at the end of each night of touring, watching the last round of the fabulous lights on the tower. Magical. The hotel is a moderate walk from the nearest metro, which is not on a main line but easy enough to transfer to. We took the metro home each night after seeing Paris. The hotel is very close to a bus stop that has service right along the river, including direct access to the tower, the Louvre, and many other sites. We took this bus in the mornings. It was very full, but we got where we wanted to get to efficiently. The service at the hotel was great. They provided valuable advice and also arranged a shuttle to the airport that we had not planned on, but the price and convenience they were able to provide was great. We used the computer in the lobby to print our boarding passes -- a must for efficient travel these days. We did not eat at the hotel, but did sample a few things at the nearby cafes -- very good. I am a geek who travels on business doing geeky things, so I always rate the geek factors. For this hotel there was free wireless Internet, but you do have to ask the desk for the Wi-Fi code. The network was adequate, and I did get done what I needed to get done. I did have trouble finding free plugs in the room to charge the geek toys, but I managed by unplugging a lamp. More accessible plugs are needed. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Small, friendly and cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: MMTMRome
Reviews.Content: I regularly visit Paris and have found myself in some pokey and over-priced hotels. This is not one of them. The room price was reasonable adn the location good, though not very central. Metro, RER and good shopping and restaurants are within 5-10 minute's walk. There are basic facilities very close to the hotel. My room was small - you learn to expect this in European city hotels - but adequate. A comfortable 3/4 size bed (which may have been a squeeze for a couple, but was fine for a lone traveller), compact wardrobe, newly fitted bathroom with shower, excellend double glazed windows that shut out all street noise, good TV, good desk space, power points, lights and nice furnishings. I was impressed with how efficinetly they had used space to create a comfortable room. Heating was great - if anything the room was too warm. Free fast internet is provided. Reception was efficient checking in and out, adn staff were always very friendly and spoke good English. The breakfast room is in the cellar. Breakfast includes a great selection of home made quiche, omelettes, cakes and pies that are pretty irresistable, as well as fruit, pastries, bread etc. I was happy the hotel was close to the River where I ran each morning! I likes the Eiffer-Kennedy enought to go back another time, in favour of the standards or tatty cheap hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hotel in quiter area of Paris”
Reviews.Author: CD04-Melbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this little hotel in September. It was our first time in Paris. We appriciated the the hotel staff advice on where to eat, when to go to major attractions to avoid congestion. All advice were appropriate for the as we were only in Paris for 4 nights. As with what has been written by others, the rooms are small, but having checked out other reviews for a lot of hotels in Paris, it seems to be the same thing. The buffet breakfast was minimal in range but very fresh and some of the cakes were made in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Surveyor8785
Reviews.Content: We loved this little hotel! It was the smallest room of our trip; however, there was enough room to organize our belongings. The bathroom was perfect. It had been recently upgraded and had all of the necessary amenities. The staff was friendly and helpful answering our questions and giving us recommendations on food and outings. Another great factor of the hotel was the location. It was very close to several metro stops and bus stops. The neighborhood was quiet, and the restaurants were perfect. This is a good call!

Reviews.Title: “Small and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: vincec
Reviews.Content: This is a very good small hotel in the 16th arrondisment. The staff could not have been more friendly. The rooms of cpurse are small if you are basing your standards on North American hotels but spacious enough by European major cities. Spotlessly clean and a very comfortable bed. Probably would have given it 5 stars if the breakfast had have been more interesting. There are a variety of restaurants within a few blocks. The cafe next door is not the best of them from a quality and price point of view. Despite not being very central there is a bus stop almost outside the door and a Metro and PER station within a short walk. Currently about a 20 euro taxi ride from the Gare Du Nord. Well worth considering and we would happily return

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: godosan
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the Eiffel Kennedy for three nights in August/Sept. It was lovely. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Our room was very clean and quiet, and the breakfast was very good. I loved our location --- one of the best parts of the city. Everything was convenient and the cafe at the corner was a great place to end each evening. The bakery across the street and the upscale supermarket nearby were nice additions. Access to buses and taxis and subway were remarkable. Our walk to the Eiffel Tower was not difficult, and we needed the exercise. We would stay again. Sandra M.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: susan c
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay; staff very kind and helpful, excellent air conditioning and VERY clean. Tub access was difficult, no grab bars and maybe risky for those with limited flexibility. Rooms are small, no comfortable reading chairs, if English language TV is important this may not be for you; only 2 English news stations available. Optional breakfast for 10 euros was an exceptional value. Even with all my notes above, I would stay there again, the air conditioning, cleanliness and location are the most important points

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Lauren W
Reviews.Content: Just 15 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower with RER, metro, post office etc all nearby, everything is easily accessible. Rooms are small but standard for Paris. Staff were friendly and helpful at all times. One thing I would say is skip the breakfast and head to the bakery across the orad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel, and Superb Staff”
Reviews.Author: bevozilla
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel run by always helpful Bernard and his wife. Bernard's English is great and he is always helpful. I can't say enough about satisfaction with Bernard and his team. And breakfast turns out to be a bargain when I traveled more in Europe. Up to 15 euro at once place that wasn't even as nice! Access: RER C is closest but Ranelagh is close to. Even better is a whole fleet of Velolib rental bikes out front (provided by the city). I like the restaurant next door too: Cafe de la Fontaine?

Reviews.Title: “3 Star Hotel with a 5 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: inaugural
Reviews.Content: We came to Paris for 4 nights and loved every minute of our stay at the Eiffel - Kennedy. The Hotel is centrally located, exceptionally clean and has a terrific service, while still being discrete. We ate at the Bistros recommended by the Hotel and were thus able to discover some of the most marvelous gems of Paris. From the Hotel you can walk to the Eiffel Tower in 20 minutes as well as reach Versailles in under half an hour. Overall a true d

Reviews.Title: “Very grateful for this wonderful, comfortable hotel in Paris!!”
Reviews.Author: grevisj
Reviews.Content: My son was studying abroad in France and was looking for a nice location to stay in Paris. I found this on Trip Advisor and it did not disappoint ! My son said the hotel was very clean, comfortable, and in a GREAT location. He was very grateful for the friendly staff. As his mother setting this up from the USA, I was grateful as well! Thank you Eiffel-Kennedy!! He will be staying with you again this weekend for one last weekend in Paris :)) MERCI'

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: SkovgaardMoeller
Reviews.Content: We visited the hotel twice during July with our 1 year old daughter and are very satisified with the hotel and the staff. We got a larger room on arrival to ensure space for the baby bed and all efforts were made to satisfy our needs and requests. The hotel is located in a relatively quiet area close to cafÃ©s, shopping streets, Metro and RER stations. The breakfast was varied, plenty and delicous - definitely worth the 10 â‚¬. We recommend the hotel for all types of visit to Paris due to the central location, nice rooms and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, large price, but big on service”
Reviews.Author: suemarieklas
Reviews.Content: We just got back from spending 4 nights at the Eiffel Kennedy Hotel in beautiful Paris. I had read that the rooms were small and they were right. But the location was great, the air conditioning worked, the bathroom was very modern and the staff (Bernard, Simone) were outstanding. They even obliged our daily request for a bowl of ice for our drinks, without question. We appreciated their assistance with directions to places and arranged for our shuttle pick-up when we were leaving. It was close to both RER and Metro stations, right next door to a restaurant and wine shop. Our bed was larger than I thought and very comfortable. And, yes, free internet! I would recommend it to anyone traveling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “If you want outstanding service and a great hotel, this is your spot!”
Reviews.Author: Texasgal5
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week and LOVED this jewel. The staff went over and above to provide for us and helped us with directions, etc. We were close to downtown/Eiffel Tower. The bus is down the street with several markets and a bakery nearby. It was quiet at night and we loved opening our window in the a.m. and looking out over this part of the city. There is even a shuttle provided (for a fee) to get to/from the airport. I would book again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small Paris Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Chica77843
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Paris traveling with my young adult sons. Had a great stay at this hotel. The rooms are small, but this is typical for European hotels. Bathroom was large, modern, and spotless. Front desk staff were extremely kind and helpful. Near the Eiffel Tower and Metro stations. Bakery across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic hotel, unresponsive to guest problems”
Reviews.Author: rrv110070
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is good, close to Eiffel tower, however the rooms were tiny and we could not open all our bags. When we were in Paris (3rd to 6th June) it was very warm and since our room was on the fourth floor, it would get very warm. However the airconditioning would not work for more than 5 minutes and that would leave us in a sweltering room. Repeated requests to get it fixed fell on deaf ears, and we were told that since it was a weekend they could not get it fixed, well, they could house guests in the weekend! We tried to stay out as much as possible, however the rooms would be unbearable in the nights as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: KevinDsTrips
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group of friends for three nights last summer. Nice hotel that was great value considering it was the height of summer. The rooms were small but comfortable and nicely decorated. Between the velibes and metro it was a handy enough place for getting around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay . . . But Would I Return . . ?”
Reviews.Author: Room_210
Reviews.Content: First off, two common themes you'll find in the other reviews of the EKH are (1) very small rooms, and; (2) very friendly & helpful staff. I can tell you, those are both 100% accurate. I haven't stayed in Paris before, but have traveled much of western Europe: and other than Killarney Ireland, this was easily the smallest space I've slept in yet. Room enough for 2 adults I suppose, if they're on good terms. But not the room for two PLUS a child any larger than a bread loaf. The staff (primarily Bernard and Simone) are helpful and courteous to a "T" . . . nothing seems to be a problem at this hotel. Breakfast is good value for 10e, and the hotel is kept very clean. The EKH is at the tip of a busy intersection though and you do get a good amount of traffic noise when your windows are open (but NONE when they are closed). In general, the EKH is good value for the money. But. There are some issues to keep in mind. Two thoughts pop into your head when you wake in Paris: what can I see today, and what am I going to eat? So how does this hotel rate? Location: The EKH is simply not ideally located. Don't see how it can be argued otherwise It's two bridges above the Eiffel Tower, placing the EKH at the distant end of just about anything you'd want to see in Paris. Yes, it can be a fairly pleasant 30min walk to the tower in good weather, and you're close to a bus line (#72) or metro that will get you most places you want to be. But it's not comfortable walking distance to anything really, and not in sight of anything other than maybe the top 1/4 of the tower if you're on the right side of the hotel. Bottom line, the EKH feels a bit isolated, in fact. If you're not picky about your hotel being at the center of the action, heck, being at the center of *anything* then this won't be an issue for you. For me, honestly, it was something of a problem. Food: there are some very good restaurants near the EKH. There is an excellent, yes excellent, Japanese/Sushi restaurant right across the street (Sushi Gourmet, #2 Japanese on TripAdvisor). Small but well worth being crammed into. A few blocks 'up the hill' is Passy Mandarin, very acceptable Chinese. We had 3 entrees, all very very good, making us wish we had ordered a fourth. Also a few blocks up the hill, on Rue de l'Annonciation, right across the street from the Grace de Passy church, is a nice Mexican restaurant . . . but the name escapes me. Can't miss the Mexican and Texan flags outside though. What's missing from that restaurant list in Paris? French cuisine! We ate french food near the hotel, including the restaurants recco'd strongly by Bernard . . . but found all of it to be just 'OK' . . . pretty forgettable stuff. And of course pricey (but so was ALL of the food outside of the cafes). Now it could be we just caught the wrong nights, restaurants can be that way . . . but yeah, bottom line we weren't thrilled with the French cuisine we had in this neighborhood. So the verdict . . . would I stay again? I don't think so. And that's not an indictment of the hotel itself, rather just a personal preference to be in a larger room at hotel a bit more centrally located to, well, something. Would I pay more for that? Yes, in hindsight I would. Would I take a hotel with a lower Trip Advisor rating? Yes, I believe I would. If you opt to stay at the EKH, I think you've made a decent choice . . . just keep in mind that there will be some tradeoffs. You'll get a very friendly experience, but in a small, fairly isolated, package. Note: I rated the EKH 'very good' which is probably a hair above what it actually rates. But it's better than 'average' . . . why is there no 'good' rating on TA?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location - wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: vkyriakos
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel while being on a business trip to Paris. The hotel was just perfect for the purpose of my trip. It was conveniently located close to the place of the meeting as well as to main tourist attractions. There are two RER stations and a metro station about 300m away from the hotel. Eiffel Kennedy is a small charming hotel in a nice area near Passy area and the Eiffel Tower. The rooms are quite good for Paris standards, much better than other hotels that you can get for a similar price in this area. The bathroom was spacious and recently renovated while the room furniture was a bit outdated. The breakfast was ample and delicious. While most of the hotels in Paris offer a very basic breakfast, Eiffel Kennedy offers a considerable variety of choices each one worth tasting. The hotel staff is very friendly and willing to assist with anything that you may need. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel for either business or as a base for exploring Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Ayaann
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I consistently stay at this hotel whenever we are in Paris for meetings. The hotel is within walking distance of a number of major shops and pubs/diners. The staff are very friendly, helpful and courteous; and they always try to accommodate guests' preferences. The rooms -- of varying sizes -- are well-appointed; and the en-suite bathrooms have recently had a great face-lift. The breakfast buffet has a good variety of dishes to satisfy even the fussiest guest! It is a great delight to have all-day access to the free wifi connection -- available in all guest rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good value good location”
Reviews.Author: Tkyle
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel as part of a British airways package from Toronto. We read reviews prior to our visit and were happy with what was said about this hotel. It was in a great neighbourhood, with local shops and restaurants, also close to the Metro and the RER C line. The breakfast was good, a selection of quiche, eggs, croissants, yogurt etc, coffee tea and chocolate, would have liked more fresh fruit though. The rooms are small however we spent very little time in ours, the bathroom was newly renovated and had a closet with shelves and ample hangers. There are many things to see within walking distance of the hotel, we explored the area and found many interesting shops and restaurants along Rue de Passy. CDG is easy to get to from the RER C President Kennedy stop, change to the RER B at Notre Dame/St Michel, it can be busy at times but a very inexpensive way to get to the airport. Loved Paris and would return to this hotel for the area and the value for money. Also, staff very helpful and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Eiffel Kennedy”
Reviews.Author: TamiBrad
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 (children ages 15, 12 and 9) stayed 6 nights at Hotel Eiffel-Kennedy beginning March 24. We had 2 rooms (one with double bed and one with 3 singles - they were the only 2 rooms in a small hallway that we could "lock" at night and feel the kids' room was secure). Although the room of 3 singles was tight for our daughters it worked just fine as we were not in our rooms often. Our double room was very nice and both bathrooms spacious by Paris standards. Our rooms were very clean and well taken care of by the staff. It is a family run hotel and everyone could not have been friendlier or more helpful. Simone was so helpful with bus and metro stops - especially since she spoke English and our French was limited. Breakfast was also very delicious with homemade pastries each morning in addition to other breakfast offerings. Our family greatly enjoyed our stay and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: angelina0308
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but this is normal for hotel in Paris. The rooms are very clean, the staff is extrmely polite, ready to help with anything you need. We got to the Hotel and as soon as we checked in the receptionist explained everythingwe needed to know and advised us on best and also cheapest way to see Paris. In the morning we went for breakfast which i can only describe as delicious. Every morning we had a selection of fresh cakes that are home made. The hotel is run by a family and I noticed that everyone is very proud of their job and they give 100% to satisfy customers. The location is amazing. Just a ten minutes walk and you reach the Eiffel tour. I would reccomend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: ladysmyrna
Reviews.Content: We spent one week with my husband at this hotel for our honeymoon. I can easily say that most charming points are the location and the staff! The hotel is very close to 4 metro stations, we could reach Eiffel by walking just in 10 minutes and the staff have even welcomed us with their warm wishes for our marriage, they were all very friendly and helpful while we are searching for ways to reach many places. The rooms were smaller than i expected and then they were seen in pictures, but it did not surprised us so much, because most of Paris hotel rooms were mentioned as small during our previous searches and we were outside nearly all time! The rooms and the bathroom were clean. As a result, i can say that , for a next possible Paris holiday, we can choose Eiffel Kennedy again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice location and very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: EugeneB
Reviews.Content: We had a honeymoon in August of 2010 and travelled throughout the France. First we stopped in Paris and spent 4 lovely nights in Eiffel Kennedy hotel. This is small, private hotel, which we would like to come back to again. The rooms are French-typically small, but very clean and convenient. The staff is very friendly, helpful, and sincere. Owner, whose name is Bernard, is a very nice man. He spent about 20 minutes on the phone to talk to local cell-phone company and select a Plan for me. Breakfasts are cooked locally by his wife, so we enjoyed home-made tasty cuisine and bakery. First we didn't realize the benefits of the location, but having spent only one night we've done! Hotel is in a quiet place, however very close to couple of metro (tube) stations, line of quick metro R (or however it is called in France) and in a walk distance from Tour Eiffel. If travelled to Paris again, I'd definitely come back to stop at Eiffel Kennedy.

Reviews.Title: “Great value with easy location”
Reviews.Author: UFPA10
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly and helpful. Metro is only 3 blocks away with 2 nice little markets on the same street about 1 block away, as well as, a nice little restaurant right next door. Nice little neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place for my niece and me!”
Reviews.Author: motown47
Reviews.Content: My niece and I stayed here in September and it was perfect! I had booked this hotel because I wanted separate rooms for us. I booked a "suite" expecting a sitting room with a pullout sofa and a bedroom. Much to my surprise, it was so much better! We had a section of the hotel that was separated from the other rooms by a door we could lock. When we got into our section, there were two full bedrooms--each with its own bathroom. We each had our privacy yet we were together. This would be a perfect situation for a family who wanted kids in separate room but still away from other guest rooms. When we were in Paris, the weather was perfect. Slept with the windows wide open! (there are no mosquitoes in Paris) Had no problem with noise. Also loved the little restaurant around the corner where we had a nightcap each night. The staff was terrific and helped us with our sightseeing plans. I would highly recommend the Eiffel Kennedy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Pirooz51
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. It was a small hotel with clean rooms and polite staffs. But in October when the outside temperature was about 4C at night the hotel heating system didnâ€™t work and we really spent unforgettable nights because of cold. The Eiffel tower is about 30 min. walk and for reaching to nearest metro station at least 10 min. walk. Free internet access and incredible staffs are the highlights of this hotel. I will select it again for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff Makes this Hotel a Great Value”
Reviews.Author: DrLeeB
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eiffel-Kennedy Hotel for 5 nights in late September - early October and was generally very pleased. I arrived at 9:30 AM after an overnight flight and was delighted to find that my room was already available so I could take a short nap and freshen up before setting off to explore Paris. The staff speaks English quite well and are very willing to offer suggestions on everything from best ways to get to various tourist attractions to restaurants in the area. My room, though a bit small, was clean and quite comfortable. The neighborhood is quiet by Paris standards with plenty of restaurants and other useful businesses (such as a small grocery store and a laundramat) close by. I could have done without the construction site out the window, and I never could get the wireless internet to work in my room for long. I usually had to come downstairs with my laptop or use the public computer in the business center. But these are minor complaints. From start to finish, the Eiffel Kennedy staff made my visit to Paris very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, great location, great helpful staff, great breakfast, cafe next door.”
Reviews.Author: DavidBtraveler
Reviews.Content: My title says it all. I would definitely stay here again. It's within walking distance of the Metro and the Eiffel tower. The staff all speak a useful amount of English, and are helpful with directions, tips, arranging a shuttle to the airport, requests for the rooms, etc. The breakfast basement is charming and the food is nice. One of the best features is the cafe right next door--we spent an inordinate amount of time there eating and drinking and soaking up a corner of Paris. Note: this is not a chain hotel; it is a boutique hotel, and has a good local flavor.

Reviews.Title: “Bernard is great host”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small - though as expected. The rooms and hotel were clean, quiet and a good value. Bernard was very helpful in planning our days. We were traveling with our daughter and son in law on 60th birthday trip of 3 weeks in France/Italy. We stayed with Bernard for 7 nights. Close location to metro and RER. Several good restaurants in the area. The breakfast was good - meats cheese granola yogurt and quiche for 10 euro. No parking available.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and enjoyable stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: awilton
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for four nights while vacationing in Europe . It wasn't the most modern of hotels and it didn't really match the website and the room was small., but the friendliness of the hotel staff made the difference and we enjoyed your stay. Bernard the owner was very helpful, as was Simon. His wife Jocelyn who prepares and manages the cafe was also very pleasant. We would definately recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a nice family atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: nelson022
Reviews.Content: Bernard and his staff extend a warm welcome, nothing is too much trouble for them. Lovely clean, well maintained hotel, excellent breakfasts, the cakes are to die for. Windows well soundproofed so a good night's sleep is guaranteed. Only 5 or so minutes from Ranelagh metro, or RER, and buses 72, 70, 52 get you just about anywhere comfortably. The "swan" island provides a lovely evening walk. Just up the rue Boullainvillier is a great shopping area with lots of little artisan shops. Cannot wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: 33447DianeT
Reviews.Content: I was extremely happy with our choice of the HEK. The room was not teeny tiny, the bathroom was really clean with great hot water and shower pressure. The beds were comfortable. The location was great, i would definitely stay in this area of paris again. The staff was SUPER friendly and helpful, they could answer all of our questions, with great recommendations for hotels. The only issues i had were: if it were summer it would have been very noisy - with the window open it was noisy, and there is a construction project going on next door that started up around 7 am. with the window closed it was fine, but the weather was cool, so it was fine. The wifi was great when it worked, but there were two nights out of the five that it just didnt work and the guy at the desk didn't know what to do, or didn't try to reset it or anything. My friend who had an adjoining room said that her neighbors were quite "noisy" in the night, and she could hear it all, but i didn't find that. My room was 426 and i didn't hear any of my neighbors. the breakfast was good, and reasonably priced. and the brasserie right downstairs was awesome! good salads and wine and very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lincstraveller3
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel to be greeted by friendly owner who was very helpful giving us good local information with regard to transport and eateries. It is well situated and the number 72 bus will take you most places you want to go in the city. Our deal did not include breakfast but we would say that it is well worth the 10 euro charge. Rooms and service very good. Would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for bath and sleep”
Reviews.Author: RestlessTourist
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to the Eiffel tower, but it is not very close to a metro station (about 10 minutes walk, 5 minutes away from a RER station). The room is quite small and maintenance issues are only handled the day after (usually you'll bump into them in the evening, after you're back at your room). Staff is friendly and attentive and the neighborhood is safe at nights. There is a very good sushi place (called Sushi Gourmet) close by. Although not complimnetary, breakfast (10 Euro) is a good start for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Now that's what I call customer service!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CalgarianinFrance
Reviews.Content: I just can't say enough about the treatment we received from everyone at the hotel. When the infamous one-day transit strike hit, Bernard helped our group of 8 secure a private car to get us to the two events we had planned for that day. I'm not sure what we would have done without him. (And that was just part of the daily treatment we received.) Everyone was so friendly & helpful and I would highly recommend this hotel. The rooms were very clean and the breakfast was fresh and delicous. Since I plan to visit Paris again, I will definitely stay there again. The location was fabulous (just a short walk to the Eiffel tour, Seine and all major transportation). Thanks for making an amazing trip just that much better!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MancuniaTraveller
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel was great. The staff were all excellent and spoke great English. The room was clean with a miad service daily. The bed was comfy. The shower was warm and powerful enough. The windows were glazed so well there were no noises from the busy streets. The hotel is handily near Ranlagh Metro stop, which is on Line 9 connecting to the Eiffel Tower, Champs Elysees and Louvre. It is walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, which takes about 15-20mins along a path in the middle of the river, very lovely walk. I could not praise the hotel highly enough! I would definately recommend anyone to stay there. I have sent an e-mail of thanks to the hotel and would definately return. Oh and the Cafe next door was great too. Loevly to sit and have a glass of wine and also did great food. I can recommend the cheese board with meats.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay & near Ranelagh metro station”
Reviews.Author: BeachyKeen_9
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and thought it was great. The staff speak wonderful English, so if you're worried about how to get directions -- or just worried about language in general -- you won't have any problems at all staying at the Hotel Eiffel Kennedy. The hotel is a nice walk from the Ranelagh metro stop, so if you don't want to have to transfer using the nearest RER line, you only have to walk up Rue L'Assumption, which isn't a bad stroll. I'd say it takes about 10 minutes, depending on how quickly you choose to get there. One tip: When first arriving and exiting Ranelagh station, regardless of the side of the street you emerge from, you'll want to simply turn around and walk towards the way your back was facing as you exited the stairs of the station. You'll quickly hit Rue L'Assumption, and simply make a left. Walk to the bottom of the slightly inclined 'hill' and you're there. Yes, the rooms are small, but that's Europe. And quite honestly, how often are you in the room anyway? You'll be out seeing the sights. Bernard is wonderful and so is the night staff and Simone. They go out of their way to help you, and they were quick to inform us of strikes on the RER line that might interrupt our plans to travel to Versailles -- or any other destination. It would be nice if the hotel were closer to the metro, but all in all, it served as a great spot to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: dgp41482
Reviews.Content: Overall a good stay, the room was comfortable but small. I liked the bed it was very comfortable, and the fridge helped also. We did use the A/C and it worked ok. The shower worked overall but the tub was a few inches off the floor so was tricky getting into and the tub had a angled bottom so my footing was not as sure as I would like. The water was hot but regulated so it took time to wash. The room was cleaned daily and the staff was nice overall. The first day was slightly dissappointing. We had just spent 10 hours on trains getting to the room from Switzerland and we had to wait 15 minutes for the one desk clerk to check us in because he was giving directions around Paris to another guest. It was a painful 15 minutes. I understand giving good directions but they should be more aware of the people arriving exhausted and might want to take care of them before going long winded explaining the finer points of how the metro works. I really loved the breakfast, it is overpriced for what it is but we got a great rate and included breakfast thru the BritishAirways website. There were always different baked goods like tarts and egg and ham pie. There was also cereal, yogurt, cheese, different breads, coffee, tea, juice, fruit. My favorite was a berry tart and the egg and ham pie. All of it was cold but some things were offered to be heated up. The tables were cleaned sporatically, most of the time it was very clean and other times we could not find a clean table. Overall I liked the breakfast because it was all you can eat and I usually ate alot. It was much easier than finding an overpriced bakery or cafe to have breakfast. Paris is so spread out that it was nice to have at least one easy meal to count on each day. Location wise the hotel was pretty good 15 minutes to the Eiffel Tower along a very nice park. There was a nice streetside market midweek also. As for other sights they are a distance away. I imagine staying in the Latin Quarter would be more central to most sights or Rue Cler but you are going to have to travel to most sights anyways. The RER stop is close and will get you to the Champs de Mars (Eiffel Tower) stop easily and from there it is a pretty easy transfer to most anywhere. There are some bus stops near by as well but the bus system is slower and is not always going in the direction you will want. We never made it to the closest Metro stop since it was unnecessary due to the RER stop much closer and ties into the metro at the Eiffel Tower. Get a good dedicated RER, Metro, and Bus maps since the combined maps leave out alot of detail you will need to get around. I liked this hotel, it would be nice to be more central, but I could not find a hotel available for the same price and rating in a more central location so I grabbed this one. Rental Apartments are nicer but there is a deposit and key hassle with those and since this was one of 3 stops for us I didn't need anymore complications. I would recommend this hotel, there were no surprises and overall the staff was friendly and helpful. I did appreciate the cleanliness and the elevator. Also there are 3 markets close by that can save you a bunch on food costs. There is also a cafe and a bakery practically at the front door. Overall on a scale of 1 to 10 I would say an 8. Recommended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty at the Hotel Eiffel Kennedy”
Reviews.Author: mummyfan
Reviews.Content: My sister and I had only 2 days at this hotel, but it was the best one we stayed at during our entire trip. We went to Edinburgh and London, and nothing could compare to the Hotel Eiffel. The friendliest staff imaginable, the yummiest classic French breakfast, the loveliest rooms, and the most beautiful little area. Everyone there spoke English and helped us get where we needed to go. They even have a computer with internet in the lobby that you can use for free! Love this place. I will stay there again when I come back. Very worth the money. (Fairly inexpensive by the way.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Service-Price-Value-Location !!”
Reviews.Author: JulieCV
Reviews.Content: A group of 8 of us stayed at Eiffel-Kennedy; Bernard, Simone and all staff were very accomodating & helpful. Clean & safe, great area for touring, shopping & eating. Great convenience to have breakfast on premises. I would definitely go back and stay with them again ! Keep in mind this is Europe.......so rooms are smaller than most North American hotel rooms........... but charm makes up for it ! Julie.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and good affordable place to stay - Nice Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: zeetoner
Reviews.Content: Arrived tired with 7 pieces of luggage and rooms are not really set up for that. Owner/Manager gave us 2 adjoining rooms and blocked off the section so that we were able to leave a few pieces in a locked hallway all to ourselves. It was like a private wing. We were with our 3 children ageed 21 & 18 & 11 Pros - Super nice owner & Staff - they speak English quite well too Reasonably good location - it is near the statue of liberty and you can see the Eiffel tower when you walk up to the main square It is a 15-20 minute walk to the tower however - there are a few metro stations within a 5-10 minute walk and there is a regular bus that does many of the sites as well Breakfast is very good - not a full American style breakfast - but it does include quiche and yogurts etc. - try to book with the breakfast included Cons - Rooms are small (like most of the hotels in Paris) The restaurant/tavern around the corner (which is not part of the hotel) is not very good for food - but the beer is good We arrived near the end of the Paris summer holidays - and many restaurants and stores were closed - (Paris empties out during the month of August) so we did not have a chance to try out some of them - we ended up eating where we could and in St Germain Paris is sooooo expensive - This has nothing to do with the hotel - but - you DO NOT need to tip in Paris when you eat - and IF you do - you do NOT need to tip 10-15% - a few Euros is a nice thank you (this is after I gave a 15% tip at the so-so restaurant around the corner and they gave me a shocked look - Great hotel for the price - bathrooms were clean and even though rooms were small - it was fine for a short stay - the nice people (daytime manager is the owner and his wife is the person who serves breakfast) made it a good stay - they were truly helpful and all in all I would recommend this hotel as a very fair and decent place to stay Some other tips The Hop on - Hop off tour buses are well worth it The museum pass allows you to bypass many lines (we saved at least 2 hours at the Louvre) Travel light if you can 1 Taxi for 5 people (minibus) back and forth to CDG was 150 Euros (like 200$ - totaly OUTRAGEOUS !!) - so travel light and take the RER or the Metro from CDG Once again - for the money - based on so many other hotels close to the tower etc.. YES - a decent choice Oh - if you are booking more than one room - call the hotel directly AND leave a note on your booking to ask them for adjoining rooms - they did it for us :)

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: L0lasMum
Reviews.Content: We booked this gem very last minute - the day of arrival. After an interesting experience at another Paris hotel (we checked out early) to arrive at the Eiffel Kennedy was heavenly! It's a smart, well situated and excellently run 3* hotel with much character. The lady who checked us in couldn't have been more helpful or welcoming - she even carried our 22kg suitcase up the stairs as the lift was out of use!! She was also very kind to our young daughter and gave her a mini Eiffel Tower. The rooms, although small are excellently arranged and furnished with everything you need and spotlessly clean. The Tower is a pleasant 15 min walk away and there are several Metro and RER stations close by. We would without a doubt stay here again and would highly recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Everything and more in a hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Hall-Family-of-5
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Paris was made just that much more special with our stay at the Hotel Eiffel-Kennedy. From the answering of our many questions leading up to our visit to their always friendly and attentive support, our stay was simply excellent! the Hotel is well situated to all amenities, spotless, nicely appointed and jocelynes breakfasts are spectacular! Bernard and Jocelyne, we can't say enough about our stay at your hotel. We feel we gained not only a great place to stay while in Paris but also some new friends.... Merci beaucoup! Brian, Joanne, Breanne, Kendra and Cydney

Reviews.Title: “quaint and comfortable....”
Reviews.Author: Topender1
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this small boutique hotel to people looking for a medium range hotel with a fair price, and the convenience of location to Paris central. It has nice little breakfasts, free internet (only one computer), small but comfortable and clean rooms. It is very handy to trains, buses, and shops. There is a laundrymat, bakery, corner stores, and resteraunts within a stones through. The staff are friendly and more than willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: jdallegr
Reviews.Content: If you want a neighborhood hotel and experience the charm of Paris, this is the hotel for you. The location is good with cafes and bakeries around. You can get to the Eiffel tower by walking in about 15-20 minutes on a nice walk along the Seine river. From there you can walk to the Invalides for another 15 minutes. The walk is worth it. If you don't like walking, there is a bus line that goes along the River all they to the Louvres. The bus station is close to the hotel. You can also find a subway station a few blocks away from the hotel. The room are small as expected in an old building. The elevator is small as well. The owner/staff was super friendly and useful. He setup the hotel with a WIFI station at every floor, so the Wifi quality was the best we found during our 3 weeks trip in Europe. It was free as well. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel as we wanted to go to local cafes instead. Don't drive in Paris; it's not worth it. The bus/subway system is very good and parking spaces are hard to find. The only drawback at the time was that the hotel is next to Radio France building, which was experiencing some renovation. So the front of the hotel was in front of a construction field. IT was not a problem at all since they stop working quite early. I definitely recommend this hotel if you want to experience the typical Paris feel.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Paris!!”
Reviews.Author: YianniosFamily
Reviews.Content: We found the best value for money hotel in all of Paris! A very charming and unassuming hotel in a quiet neibourhood with all of the attractions Paris has to offer nearby. The staff were very freindly and extremely helpful (thanks heaps Bernard!) and nothing was too much trouble for them. Our check in was speedy and our rooms were very nice with a fabulous view of the Eiffel Tower! The rooms were a good size with nice furnishings and very clean. The beds were very comfortable and the pillows soft and fluffy. The bathroom was clean and a good size but the towels could've been a bit softer. Hotel Eiffel Kennedy is close to the metro, RER & bus lines and all easy to use. Jocelyn's breakfast was fantastic; a great selection of breakfast items and very filling and at 10 euro, a bargain. All in all, this is a great hotel and l would recomment it to everyone. It exceeded our expectations and we would gladly go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous accommodation and fine hosts”
Reviews.Author: Penigal
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the hotel our first impression - very tastefully decorated and well maintained premises. That impression stayed with us for all areas we used - from the exterior, reception, stairs, bedrooms, breakfasting area. In addition, from the word go through to our departure we received a friendly, helpful service from Bernard and his colleagues/staff at Reception and from the girls serving le petit dejeuner. Le petit dejeuner, which we opted for every morning offered a healthy variety and good value for money at 10 euros per person (at time of visit because there was three of us sharing a room which included our teenage son, we benefitted from an offer 3 breakfasts for the price of two). It was also a bonus when Bernard advised us on arrival, that a triple room was available to us for nights 3 and 4. At time of booking, only available accommodation for 4 nights was a double room with an extra bed ( 2 adults and our son) which didn't pose a problem for us as we considered it purely a base to return to after a day of sightseeing but must say we were very grateful for the extra space. The hotel is at busy junction but effective double glazing shuts out traffic noise. Excellent air conditioning to counteract the effects of hot, balmy summer nights! Transport links to/from hotel to Paris are excellent - a five minute walk to the nearest Metro station and 2 minute walk to bus stop for the regular number 72 service which is a 10/15 mins bus ride to city centre passing landmarks including the Eiffel Tower, Place de la Concorde, Tuilieres Jardins. The Eiffel Tower is a comfortable 20 minute walk from the hotel. As a family we are great walkers so for 3 out of the 4 days of our stay we chose to walk the 40 minutes each way it took to get to the Champs Elysee and back. There are several brasseries/restaurants in the vicinity of the hotel - we had a delicious meal and good service at the nearby Chinese restaurant on the first evening and twice at Fiorentinis.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: fleur77
Reviews.Content: A perfect hotel for stay in this lovely city in a very nice neighborhood close to metro.:) We truly enjoyed our stay and wouldn't hesitate to come back. Hanna & Mike

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: MannMom
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 arrived in Paris for a 4 night stay after staying in a cramped room in London for a week. We were so pleasantly surprised! The owner greeted us at the desk by name before we even introduced ourselves! Guess we looked like the "American family of 4". We were given 2 adjoining rooms down a small hallway with its own locked door so we felt very secure allowing our 13 and 15 yr olds to stay in their own room. View of top half of Eiffel Tower. Desk staff very helpful in giving us subway and bus route advice. Close to small grocery stores, lots of restaurants, a great bakery. 5 minute walk from the original Statue of Liberty (smaller than I thought). Maybe a 30 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower- we hopped on the bus. The only thing I didn't like about our room was the handheld shower in the bathroom. Our wall attachment was missing (our girls had one) so you really do have to hold the shower head (hard to wash hair). Not a huge deal. Nice sized bathroom. Must shut the windows at night to drown out the significant city noise. We did this and put the air conditioner on and slept fine. We ate at 4-5 restaurants all within 1-2 blocks and liked them all EXCEPT the one attached to the hotel (no connection). Ate the 10 Euro per person hotel breakfast a couple of times downstairs but none of my family eats enough to justify the price. Went accross the street to the bakery and store and fed entire family for less than 10 Euro. Food and beverages expensive in Paris. Always ask for tap water in restaurants or you will pay big bucks for bottled water. A Coke costs 4-6 Euro! Free wireless internet throughout the hotel also a plus.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms are cozy, but who goes to Paris to stay in a hotel room?”
Reviews.Author: enmorecat
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small and if you wanted to swing small animals around, you should look elsewhere, but they were clean and well-kept. The staff were amazingly helpful with tips on getting to places and eating alternatives and really helped make our stay a memorable one. The brasserie next door is pretty decent value, with good food and there is a good super market about 5 minutes walk away and near it a newsagent that sells the UK Telegraph. The hotel has internet available and the breakfast is worth paying the 10 eur for. We were full almost every day and hardly needed lunch and it was great quality. It was about a 30 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and there are several decent cafes not far away (10 minute walk). There are buses within a ten minute walk that take you to many of the main places a first-time tourist would likely visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: SamTang
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in June. My comments: Pro: 1) Good staff -Bernard is nice. I asked him to find something in Paris for me. When he found it, he SMS me through my mobile phone!! I know he works by his heart because he is the owner of the hotel. I am also the owner of SME business in Thailand. - Simone: She gave the good info to go around in Paris by train, bus or boat. Thank you - Chef: She made the good home-made breakfast for me everyday. The breakfast is 10 euro ( reasonable price in Paris). - Maid: She made the room and toilet very clean. 2) Location: quite near the center of Paris. The area looks safe to me 3) Restaurant: The French cafÃ© in front of hotel is good. I had the fish main course(13 euro) which included fish, salad, bread (with free water). When I had dinner near Opera, I had to pay for Evain( no free water) for 5 euro. There are the small Chinese and Japan rest nearby. I had the Chinese food- just Ok but cheap. 4) Hotel: Window is soundproof but the wall is not. Sometimes you can hear from the next room- but not the major problem. The room is very clean but small( this is Paris). There are 2 small grocery and drug stores near the hotel. Con- minor problems, not serious - There are 2 train stations near hotel. They are a little bit far(but not too far). RER C is about 5 min walk uphill. The metro is 10 min walk. - The hotel should have small note papers in the room. In conclusion, the hotel is good with reasonable price in Paris. I would recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Small gem with a view of the tower”
Reviews.Author: tecgrp
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with our 20 year old daugther stayed at this hotel on our way to visit family in Cyprus. We chose this hotel based on recommendations from trip advisor, and as usual member reviews were right on. The small family run hotel was indeed conveniently located to experience the sights of Paris. Mass transportation was very convenient. The neighborhood had ample services. The english speaking staff were very accomodating, helpful and friendly. Our rooms (we took two) were small (this is Paris after all) but were impeccably clean and nicely decorated. We enjoyed breakfast each day at the hotel. It was reasonably priced and had a nice variety of choices. The room rates were a good value for Paris. As a matter of fact, we stayed at the hotel twice, two nights on the way to and four nights on the way back from visiting family in Cyprus. My family and I felt the Eiffel Kennedy was indeed a great choice and a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: csg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in June. The location is in a safe area of Paris, away from the bustling crowds of the more "touristy" areas. It is near several transportation options, the River Seine, and the Eiffel Tower. Bernard, the owner, and Simone, a receptionist, spoke English very well and were very helpful with all our questions. The rooms were small (which I always expect in Paris), but they were extremely clean and had everything we needed. The wifi was spotty, but it mostly worked and was free. We didn't try the breakfast - I believe it was 10 euro. Our windows were sound proof, and we heard nothing even though we were 2nd floor with a window right on the front. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris, and I hope to stay again some day.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well-located hotel with courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: hash55
Reviews.Content: The room for a couple is comfortable. Storage is adequate. Bathrooms are clean and the shower/tub/toilet was in good working condition. The relatively quiet a/c unit helped on a couple of warm days. The room was non-smoking but on a couple of occasions, cigarette smell crept in from other rooms -- not a major problem. The breakfast is good. The hotel is within walking distance to Eiffel tower and also 150 m from the Boulainvilliers station which connects to almost all Paris attractions (D'Orsay, Rodin, Louvre, Notre Dame, Concorde, Invalides, etc.) within 1/2 hour. In addition, there are a lot of cafes, restaurants close by and also an ATM machine right across from the hotel. The Wifi access was sporadic but you must take directions from the staff to connect to the modem on your floor. The hotel is reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad - although not great”
Reviews.Author: CvrGrl
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at the Eiffel Kennedy hotel from May 24th-28th. While I can say that most of the staff were very helpful, and the hotel conveniently located to the Eiffel Tower, it was not quite what I had in mind. When we arrived and checked in, we realized our room was right next to the elevator. My mom ask to switch it to a quieter location and Bernard was super nice, and provided us with another room pronto! The room we booked was a double, twin bedded room, and I have to say it was pretty tiny (as most are). However, just coming from Florence, and from a nice sized room, this one was kind of a letdown. The beds were ok, nothing to scream about, but I was thankful they had plenty of pillows. The bathroom was a decent size, however the blow dryer was so ancient, it took me about 25 minutes to dry my hair in the morning. One complaint I have is that there was only one mirror - in the bathroom, which meant that if my mom was taking a shower, I had to prop my compact up on the window sill and attempt to do my makeup and hair that way. Very inconvenient, and I think this is something they could easily change in the rooms. Even though the hotel is located off of a busy street - the windows are pretty sound proof (except when motorcycles go by, you definitely hear those!). The breakfast in the morning was awesome, and cooked homemade by the owner's wife. She was very pleasant and welcoming every morning when we came down. We really enjoyed the marvelous offerings and coffee! As I mentioned before, the hotel was in a good location for the Eiffel Tower, but that's about it. There were not many restaurants nearby, unless you wanted to walk ten blocks away uphill (for my mom, that was a little difficult in the evenings). There is one restaurant next door but it wasn't that great and we opted not to eat there. The RER stop is a short walk away which was nice, and there was a bus stop at the end of the street. It just took a while (and some changing) to reach places like Sacre Couer. I would have to say, out of the staff, Bernard (the owner) is the most helpful and friendly. He provided us many recommendations for getting to sites, and thoroughly explained how to get there. Simone, another employee, was not so great at this. When we asked her questions, she seemed annoyed and gave very vague directions that we were unclear about. The computer in the lobby is helpful for checking email or weather, but since there is only one, it was often being used, so trying to find a time to get to it was hard. Overall, I would say this is an ok hotel if you are on a budget, but I don't think I'd say here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: aloneinkyoto
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers clean, comfortable accommodation very near Radio France and handy for two metro stations. Staff and management are friendly and helpful. The room was small (as are most rooms in Paris, unless you are paying a small fortune) but was well-equipped. The air conditioning was very much appreciated as the weather was very warm. There was a good choice at breakfast which cost extra but was better value than the breakfast at the Paris hotel we stayed at last year. A good base for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MoloyBiswas
Reviews.Content: The 1st think which I should be mentioning is about Bernard. He is always helpful and eager to help. We had some problem in reaching the hotel as we took the RER B trains from CDG2 airport and got down at St Michaels but we could not eventually change at St Micheals and had to take a taxi from there and end up paying 20 Euro. However once we reached the hotel it was a nice soothing experience. The lady who was at the reception helped us in checkin and we could do all the formalities in exactly 3 minutes. I forgot the name of the lady at the reception, but she was quite prompt. The best part is that she spoke to us in english. Our room was small but nice. We could see the Eiffel tower from our room. And it looked beautiful when the lightes on the Eiffel Tower was lit in the evening. The bath was spacious and adequately filled. Next day morning we met Bernard and he was very nice and explained us [in details] what and how we should roam in paris. Even to the extent that he came out of the hotel to show us the street we should take to reach the Eiffel Tower.... Bernard you rock !!!! Breakfast - another attraction of the hotel.... fully spread breakfast with lot of options of bread, homemade cakes and pastries and we were also offered hot boiled egg.... we were really surprised... Thank you Jociline..... Shekhar, the gentleman who stays at the reception after 8, is from India and was equally helpful in booking the airport pickup for us. The hotel is very conveniently located.... 15-20 minutes walk to the Eiffel Tower, and on the way you could see the Statue of Liberty [specially made for Paris] as well....... Bernanrd call us at 4 o'clock in the morning to say goodbye, which was quite unexpected and we will remember him for this gracious attitude. We will definitely stay at Eiffel Kennedy next time we visit Paris....

Reviews.Title: “Super Experience”
Reviews.Author: nyekasper
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights early May in room 430. Nice small clean room with a beatiful view of the Eiffel Tower from the window. Very friendly and service minded staff. Breakfast buffet was nice. Location was i a quiet area but still with plenty of restaurants and cafÃ©'s available within short distance. Also public transport available within very short distance. The nearby RER line from Avenue du pdt Kennedy brings you close to all the sights in Paris. And the Eiffel tower is a very beatiful 15 minuttes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Go Again and Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: byairorsea
Reviews.Content: Fantastic small hotel (32 rooms I think) accross street from Radio France Tower Bldg. and 2 blocks from Seine. Bus 22 stops in front and the RER C train is just 2 blocks away (ave Pte Kennedy). Yes, slightly small rooms, but clean and comfortable. Owners and staff were wonderful. Mrs. D really bakes some wonderful french treats for the great breakfast buffet optional for fee or included. Wonderful neighborhood tho parking a car might be tedious - we used only public transport. Internet in lobby very handy too. Some interesting restaurants, ATM's and shopping all convenient. There's a street market accross street on Tues am. Hate to tell too much about this place, it might not be "vacant" next time I want to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: cutecdnchick
Reviews.Content: I would definately go back. Location was very convenient, short walk to the subway, and about 15-20mins to the Eiffel Tower. Very safe residential neighbourhood. Great value for the location and service. Breakfast was included and quite delicious, a nice variety of food. Rooms were small and the bed was quite firm, but can't expect luxury size and bedding for the price paid. Free Wi-Fi was a nice bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place with Good Access”
Reviews.Author: Siavashpolo
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights in the last days of December 2009 at Eiffel kennedy hotel. The place was recommended to me by a friend which had the exprience of staying there. Generally was good specially because of the friendly people with good advices working there (Bernard the French gentleman) . Highly recommended for the people which go to Paris for the first time. Good access to the Metro & Bus lines and short distance to Eiffel tower. The rooms are small but clean, and the price is fair for Paris. (Traveler From IRAN)

Reviews.Title: “Really friendly hotel, very clean and tidy”
Reviews.Author: dee4lifeBath_england
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in February 2010. My wife and I had one room and my 2 kids had the room next door. The hotel is really well placed; 15 minutes walk from the tower and close to some nice places to eat. The people in the hotel were very friendly, offering recommendations for restaurants and giving some advice on travel. The hotel is located just behind the Radio France building. This is a good landmark. It is also 2-3 minutes walk from the river the Statue of Liberty (The smaller, newer French one) Try and catch the number 72 bus. This takes you down a great route past the tower and down to the Louvre. One small concern is that they are building on the Radio France site. This is a bit noisy in the morning; we were on the top floor, so I would ask to be located there. We had rooms 427/428 and in 428 there is a view of the tower. These rooms are also next to each other and great for putting the kids next door. The rooms are small but very nicely decorated. Overall, we really enjoyed staying at this hotel and would have no hesitation in staying there again and recommending the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: MJIE
Reviews.Content: For us the perfect place to stay: easy to reach, a staff very friendly and competent, clean rooms, not expensive. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service and great location!”
Reviews.Author: KNGirlX
Reviews.Content: My family completely enjoyed our stay in this hotel. Every person we came into contact with was very pleasant, smiling, friendly, and more than willing to help. The rooms were what we expected for Paris. We stayed in the triple room which has a partial view of the Eiffel Tower and a nice sized bathroom. The breakfast is a bit pricey but is a very nice spread. This hotel is in a great location, near the #72 bus stop which takes you to most of the main sites. There is a small grocery store, frence market, bakery, atm, and even McDonald's if you miss it all within minutes walking. There are some great restaurants nearby including the one just below the hotel. We plan to visit this beautiful city again and hope to stay at the Eiffel Kennedy again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For Paris on a budget”
Reviews.Author: BritishMan
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a short break to this hotel. This hotel is perfect if you need somewhere to sleep the night and eat breakfast in the morning. Our room was rather small but clean. The breakfast room was slightly smaller than what you normally would expect. However, I booked this hotel because I required exactly what it offers... An affordable room, friendly and helpful staff along with the easy access to the RER/Metro. Would I go again?.. "ah oui ! " For a short break I would suggest A carnet of 10 tickets T+ Ticket. It cost us both around 11 Euro's for the 3 days we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, rooms small but service fantastic”
Reviews.Author: 40Foot
Reviews.Content: I could not say enough about the service we received while staying in Hotel Eiffel Kennedy, they were very welcoming and always willing to give some excellent advice on local bars and restaurants. Location wise, the hotel is only a 20 minute walk away from the Eiffel Tower and only 5-6 minute walk away from the metro. There is an abundance of quality French restaurants and bars nearby, as well as a gym 5 minutes down the road. As most people are aware, rooms in Paris tend to be small and this hotel is no exception, but they are adequate at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: NYC_Big_Apple
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a quiet area. There are a small grocery store, a bakery, a bank, and a laundromat across the street. The nearest metro station is just a 5-minute walk. The room is a little small, but we are okay with that. The staff is very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “feels like home”
Reviews.Author: piadel
Reviews.Content: Away from touristic areas full of people. Located in a nice Paris neighbourhood. Close to metro stations, safe roads. Rooms are clean, full with all basic needs. Windows are really soundproof. Helpful and nice staff. Wifi. Perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: “One word only - Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: SkyTravelPRG
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with friend of mine for a one night at weekend. Hotel has good location within walking distance from RER Av.Kennedy ( 5 mins ) as well as from METRO. Staff was very friendly and helpful, all wishes fulfilled in few minutes. Rooms are little bit smaller, but very comfortable and well equipped. Bathroom was large and well equipped as well. Just across the street are food shops, under hotel nice cafÃ© and drinks shop. Breakfast was great surprise; it was rich with lots of choices ( ham, salami, eggs, quiche, cheesecakes, apple pie, cornflakes....and much more ) This hotel I would like 100% recommend to all travellers. It combines excellent quality, friendly atmosphere and excellent services.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice!”
Reviews.Author: jmcomputergeek
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four days here in September and can say that this hotel was an excellent choice. The price was right. The location was great. And can't forget the beautiful views, the charming ambiance, and the helpful hosts!!! Our room was perfect for our needs. I would highly suggest this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “hotel away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: domtex
Reviews.Content: An owner operated hotel in Passy, far away from the crowds is a great choice if you want to be in a residential district with fewer tourists. Great location if you're a walker--4km romantic walk to the Louvres along the docks..the 72 bus is direct if you get tired and metro is very close by.. Rooms are small by N/A standards, if you want Vegas, you have to pay 3-4X the price of this hotel in Paris . If you book, ask for the rooms with windows in the bathroom,these rooms are 2 sq meters larger than the other ones and it makes a big difference. A big plus are new sound proof windows and great a/c. room cleaning is very good, beds are very comfortable. Very friendly staff including owners who work the breakfast anf front desk.t Affordable bistros ( for Paris) nearby, including a one star Michelin (ask the owner to reserve on your first day) My wife and I travel to Paris frequently.We will book there for our next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great advice from Tripadvisor - This is a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: dst103
Reviews.Content: Like the other comments stated on here, we selected this hotel, based on price, location and the trip advisor rating and we were not disappointed. It was particularly important to have somewhere nice as we were travelling with my parents as well. The hotel is in good walking distance to the Eiffel Tower and Trocadero. We got the batobus from here to travel (about E12) around the city. It's well connected (just ask the hotel staff tp point you in the direction to restaraunts and cafe's - we would not have found them by ourselves!) The rooms are cosy, clean and the en suite is modern and the shower had great water pressure. The lady who provides the service at breakfast is helpful and very friendly (5*) and there is a wide selection of breakfast items, though I think if I was there longer I would have found somewhere more scenic as an alterntive for one morning. I have kept the details of the hotel, as I would definently return, should I be in Paris in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Alternative Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: rickyrak
Reviews.Content: We came across this hotel after being turned on to it by other TA members. We can immediately see why. We were greeted by a charming man who provided us with a map and all the information about Paris. As it was our first visit to the city, he even gave us cute little eiffel tower keychains which was a nice touch. The hotel is walking distance to everything and has a slight view of the eiffel tower depending on your room. Its also in perfect distance to the metro which makes it very easy to get around. I would defenitely reccomend this to any first timers in Paris. There were also alot of tourists, so it is tourist friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect cosy Paris getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Musalugnt
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my mother and 8 yrd old daughter for a weekend in Paris. The hotel appealed to us on a ratio of Tripadvisor feedback/price - and we were not disappointed. The hotel is located just behind Radio France and there is both Metro and RER stations within a short walking distance. You are almost on the Seine and have a bit of a view of the Eiffel Tower. The rooms are tiny - but this is the norm in Paris. They are clean and the bathroom was bright and came with plenty of hot hot water - which is my happiness barometre in any hotel! Tthe service couldn't be friendlier. Bernard and his wife are lovely and you get the sense that they want to be your friends and really wnat you to enjoy their lovely city. We don't really eat breakfast so the extra E10pp wasn't a runner. Several boloungeries etc just outside the door. Children, however, get free hotel breakfast with a paying adult. All in all a great stay but don't expect any facilities or a great big space - then the business hotels are probably more your cup of tea. We had a Great time!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a charming part of Paris”
Reviews.Author: JetSetJenjer
Reviews.Content: Hotel Eiffel-Kennedy is a bit off the beaten path for tourists as far as its location near Radio France, but it's actually not a far walk to the Eiffel Tower and many other areas and less than a ten minute walk to both a Metro and RER line. There are also several Velib (bicycle) stations very close by. The hotel is located in a very nice and quiet area of Paris close to excellent shopping and good bistros/cafes. The staff had a very personal touch - they were very helpful with directions and sightseeing suggestions, and the home cooked breakfast was FANTASTIC and definitely saved on eating breakfast out! Compared to other hotels I've stayed in around Paris, the breakfast was definitely the best. Also, free wireless was a huge plus. Room size is comparable to what you would expect from a three star hotel in Paris. The room was very clean and comfortable, with a decent sized bathroom and fully opening windows in both the room and bath. It's worth it to bring your own hairdryer (the one on the wall was a little weak) or pick up an inexpensive one once you arrive if that's important to you.

Reviews.Title: “Plesant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: llytle
Reviews.Content: My sister and I were visiting Paris the end of August, 2009. We stayed at the Eiffel-Kennedy Hotel and had the most pleasant stay. Simone at the front desk was a true joy to deal with. Professional, helpful and friendly. The rooms, although small, were clean and comfortable. The online booking room rate was very reasonable. Regards, Laura Lytle, A Satisfied Customer.

Reviews.Title: “It is cheap and has free wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: luxuryhound
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at this hotel following the rave reviews on Trip Advisor and the very competitive price. I arrived before my partner and immediately cancelled our booking for the following two nights. Not sure where we went wrong but ALL we are able to say is that the hotel is cheap and has free wi-fi. It has nothing else to recommend it. Rooms are so small that it almost claustrophobic, bathrooms are dated and no-where is particularly clean. It is not well located. If you don't know Paris you assume that the Eiffel Tower is in the centre but it is not. I wouldn't say don't stay here but I would just say be aware that everyone has different standards!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Parisian Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jadeylil
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the hotel for 5 nights and really enjoyed it. Staff were great and every morning we would get a friendly bon jour from the housemaids. The reception staff were always very helpful and the lady owner who is in charge of the breakfasts is so very friendly and goes out of her way to make sure you have everything you want. The only negatives are that there is no in house movie channel and the only english speaking tv station was CNN. The restaurant next door looks really good but doesn't cater to vegetarians (which was a problem for me in Paris in general). Would definately recommend this hotel. Very clean, in a quiet area and close to laundromat (across the street) and only a 20 - 30 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. I would definately advise the wearing of comfortable walking shoes in Paris as you walk for hours on end seeing all the wonderful and amazing sights. What a beautiful City!! We loved our trip and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure in Paris”
Reviews.Author: StarinaPA
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend this hotel to anyone interested in staying in an authentic, Parisian hotel. My family and I stayed at this hotel in August, 2009. The staff made our first visit to Paris so memorable. Bernard, his wife, and the rest of the staff made us feel welcome from the minute we arrived. They did everything we needed and more.. We think the hotel is charming and comfortable, and the location was perfect.
