We were surrounded by the Paris culture, beautiful neighborhoods, shopping, and tourism; yet, the personal touches, delicious breakfast, and friendly staff made us feel right at home. On top of everything, they offered free wireless Internet, which made using our own computer in our room quite convenient. This was the only hotel we stayed in during our visit to France, England, and Belgium that offered this service free of charge. Since returning to the states, we think of this hotel with fondness: opening the windows, seeing the flowers in the box, looking out at the Eiffel Tower, visiting the street vendors, enjoying cafe au lait while sitting outside at the cafe next to the hotel, walking up the lovely circular stairway...the list goes on and on. Our cherished memories of visiting Paris will always include staying at the Hotel Eiffel Kennedy.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: elliemay5
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a short weekend break in Paris. We stayed in Eiffel Kennedy Hotel. When we arrived we got a very warm welcome and were shown to our room on the 2nd floor..The lift stopped and 2 steps later we were at the door. The hotel is tiny. The room was very small and spotless. We did not have a view of the Eiffel Tower unfortunately. The ensuite bathroom was very clean also. The walls were very thin and I could hear everything going on in the next room. I found it quiet noisy ,especially in the early mornings being so close to the lift. The hotel is 15-20 mins walk to the Eiffel Tower, which we enjoyed as we are avid walkers. The walk to the local metro station on Saturday night was tough though with high heels on. You do need to get the train to all other areas and proper footwear is essential as you do a lot of walking. The breakfast at the hotel was excellent, plenty of choice and you can eat all you want. All in all it was very quaint and friendly and the staff were fantastic. elliemay5

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to da Hotel Eiffel Kennedy - Such a lovely place, such a lovely place..”
Reviews.Author: tripping_Indian
Reviews.Content: Well u do feel dat thing about dis hotel.. I had a brief stay in dis hotel for a week or so and da experience was truly beautiful.. I was there on a business trip wid one of my colleague and though we used to be out most of da times for work (day time) and leisure (evening) but we had a warm feeling inside it.. The owner Bernard, managers Ayman and an Indian guy were very nice, welcoming and helful. Jocelyn who was running da kitchen took care of every like a mom taking care of her kids.. So Eiffel Kennedy u keep rocking!! Debapriya

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: LisburnSam
Reviews.Content: The hotel provided a lovely warm ambience from the moment we arrived. The hotel is family run and the owner and his wife were so genuine and helpful. Other staff members reflected the warmth of character of the hosts. The rooms were a little smaller than we expected but more than adequate for the needs of our family with en-suite bathrooms and TV available. The breakfast area added a lovely hidden environment where home prepared food is available in abundance and well worth the money. The rooms were meticulously cleaned each day at times which suited us. Overall the hotel's location was excellent, handy to bus and metro routes which are easy to follow and use. There were plenty of shops, cafe's and restaurants close at hand, and the hotel's proximity to the Eiffel tower is excellent. This was our first city break and hotel experience and we were highly impressed. This hotel provided a quiet oasis in a busy cosmopolitan city. We would have no trouble in recommending this hotel to other travellers, excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, friendly staff, great breakfast, construction annoying”
Reviews.Author: Staros
Reviews.Content: We spent our last night of our two week trip to France at this hotel. The staff was so friendly, even giving my daughter a little eiffel tower key chain on arrival. The room was small, but nice. The bathroom nice. If we opened the window and leaned a little to the left we could see the top of the eiffel tower, a nice touch on our last night. The breakfast the next morning was wonderful for the price compared to a lot we had. The only complaint was the construction. They truly must have started about 4:30/5:00 in the morning. It was horrible. We also had some loud neighbors, who came in singing in the hallway, but that isn't the hotel's fault. I'd make sure the construction is done before staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “It was Great stuff!”
Reviews.Author: HolidayzHolidayz
Reviews.Content: It was the best hotel ever! Bernard the hotel manager was extremely helpful. He was really patient with us, even though we knew very little French. He was always willing to go out of his way to help us. And seeing that it was our first time in Paris he always told us exactly where and how to go in Paris. The Hotel itself is very cosy and we felt right at home the moment we got there. The staffs were really friendly to us and the breakfast was REALLY delicious. The cakes were absolutely incredible. Sophia, the chef is a really good cook and the service was really professional. The rooms were kind of small but really cosy and it was really easy to get comfortable. The location was really convenient as it was very accessible to various transportations and very close to all of the famous landmarks. The area is a very safe and quiet neighbour hood and we felt extremely safe there. Truly the Eiffel Kennedy is a jewel in Paris and we recommend everyone to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Little Hotel Close to Downtown Paris”
Reviews.Author: bachaney
Reviews.Content: My dad and I stayed in this hotel for four nights in the middle of July. It was simply perfect. The room was clean and air conditioned, but also had a great window that swung open to reveal a view of our cute neighborhood in the 16th Ardt. The staff was super helpful--they could give us recommendations on everything, from what to do to where to buy chocolate (the man at the front desk recommended a shop that his family has been shopping at for 50 years!) They also gave us tips on how to use the super convenient 72 bus line (it runs along the left bank of the Seine past all of the major sites and is less than 5 minutes from the hotel) and the subway. They even had power converters that they let us borrow so we could charge our cameras and cell phones! There was free and fast wireless in the room which allowed me to use Skype to call home to the States and to check my email. And did I mention the breakfast that was included in our room rate? It was fantastic! A full spread of fresh pastries, croissant, tarts, boiled eggs, fruit, cereal and yogurt each morning. And they would make omelettes and hot chocolate on request. All in all, this is one of the best hotels i've ever stayed at in Europe. I would recommend it to anyone, and I will definitely stay there again on my next visit to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and cozy hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Blitzu
Reviews.Content: It was our 1st time in Paris and as everybody worned us we were expecting to find an old 3* hotel with small rooms. We were pleasently suprised by the staff who were very helpful in offering from the very beginning all the basic information we needed for treveling and visiting. And then we were again surprised to discover nice cozy rooms. Now I really believe that if they would have been bigger, they would miss a bit the existing charm. And is a must to be said: the rooms are extremely clean, which I consider counts a lot when returning after a long walking/visting day. We stayed for 10 days and every day the room was very well cleaned. As regards to the position: there are 3 metro, RER stations close to it, which makes it very simple to reach any destination.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: bernal09
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Eiffel Kennedy. The room was a decent size for an European Hotel. The staff was great... I must say what really makes the hotel is Bernard! We ended up on going out for breakfast everyday. What a big mistake. Bernard offered us a free breakfast on the last day and it was great. If we had known we would have had breakfast included the entire week. It is worth it! the Hotel is in a great neighborhood and just minutes from everyhting...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Quaint Hotel! Friendly Staff! Perfect walk to the Eiffel Tower!”
Reviews.Author: themcgillclan
Reviews.Content: My husband had a convention in London, so we took the train for an overnight stay in Paris. We chose this hotel based on its affordability and its distance from the Eiffel Tower. It was a clean, quaint hotel with a 15 minute picturesque walk to the Eiffel Tower, along the river. We would definitely stay here again. The staff was so friendly, gave us a map of the city, and gave us directions to the Rodin Museum, and even called us a taxi upon our checkout. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in the quiet neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Don'tDisturb
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nitghts at Hotel Eiffel Kennedy. [Guest Room] Clean & Comfortable. With a flat screen TV on the wall and a refrigerator. I saw the top of Eiffel Tower from window. [Bathroom] Soap, shampoo were provided daily. With a hair dryer, but not powerful. [Lobby / Frontdesk] Free internet PC in the lobby. The restaurant which the hotel recommended was good. [Location] Metro: I walked to the metro station; Jasmin, Ranelagh, La Muette. (Line 9) Eiffel Tower: I walked along the Seine river. Statue of Liberty is on the way to Eiffel. Art Nouveau: There are many architectures designed by the French architect Hector Guimard, Le Corbusier near the hotel. French Open Tennis: I walked to the Roland Garros, it was no problem. I hope you find my travel report with photos informative and helpful. http://dontdisturb.web.fc2.com/fra/paris_burgundy_hotel_1.html

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable AND affordable in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: hanne094
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel, given the price, for both a business and a leisure trip to Paris. The room was clean and very quiet (even though facing the lively corner - good sound insulation), the bed was very comfortable the bathroom was well functioning and the breakfast was very good (very nice staff working in the breakfast room). The location was good (great for evening walks down to the Eiffel Tower). All in all a great hotel covering most peoples every need in central Paris for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: plannerStockholm
Reviews.Content: A perfect little hotel. We were very pleased with our rooms. The location was perfect and the staff att the desk were very helpful and sympathic. The only negative was that the breakfast was served in a very small room and we sometimes had to wait in the lobby before we could eat our breakfast. We will be happy to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: Disco_Diva79
Reviews.Content: Wonderful little hotel with fantastic level of service. The concierge was lovely; friendly and very helpful; which is a wonderful way to be greeted upon your first trip to the country. Room was spotless, cosy and clean. Staff were friendly and polite and helped us with booking tours, excursions, where to go and what to see. Situated a block away from the Eiffel tower, a 10 minute walk away along the Sienne. Lovely little cafe underneath/beside the hotel - creme brulee was to die for!! Beautiful city, wonderful hotel, friendly staff â€“ what more could you wish for!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful value for money”
Reviews.Author: Laurenlee
Reviews.Content: I found the Eiffel-Kennedy listed on Booking.com while I was searching for a hotel in Paris. The plan was to find a clean and relatively central place to stay with my parents. All I was interested in getting was a fairly spacious triple room with a bathroom and an uncomplicated path towards the most important Paris amenities. When I looked at the Eiffel-Kennedy website I had a careful look at each room and, comparing the reviews, it seemed to offer good value for money. Moreover, the people who did their reviews seemed to be enthusiastic about it. I had a bad surprise when, in entering the room I found that it had nothing to do with any of the pictures posted on the website. The room wasn't even a triple: a very small bed with wheels was added in an already tiny space. On top of it, the noises coming from the pipes/toilets flushing (without even counting the noise coming from the adjacent rooms) was at times unbearable. The room rate per night was â‚¬179.00 with a night discounted to â‚¬149.00... What really got me though -and my review on Booking.com has been truncated at that point- is that a small pack of crisps and peanuts was placed in a basket along with four clean, empty glasses -I thought- as a welcome gesture. I took it as such because there was no indication of the contrary (there was no minibar at all in the room nor any tag/menu brochure with prices). It turns out that, at the end of our stay, I got charged over â‚¬20 for something I did not request. Moreover, Monoprix was so close by that I could have bought something like that for a quarter of this ludicrous charge. I thought it was just so petty, compared to what I have experienced in other hotels. Oh, and a 3 star hotel? It would be useful to know who has given away such a rating.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and spotlessly clean!”
Reviews.Author: hirondelle11
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel with small rooms, but spotlessly clean and with very friendly staff! It is located in a busy road with 2 MÃ©tro stations within walking distance of about 10 minutes (Passy and Ranelagh). My room itself was pretty basic, but well kept. The bathroom had only a shower, but I believe there are rooms with bath tubs as well. It had nothing else that other Paris hotels of this standard don't have as well, except for the free WiFi connection in the room and airconditioning as well as soundproof windows. Unfortunately the room itself was not very soundproof and I woke up when my neighbor came home at 1.00 a.m. and took a shower. Breakfast was included in my rate and consisted of different kinds of sweet cakes, brioche etc., quiche, baguette, cold meat and cheeses, hard boiled eggs, fruit, yoghurt etc., but there is a small bakery across the hotel where one could also buy something and skip the breakfast at the hotel. All in all a good stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, quiet and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Cykelkat
Reviews.Content: Very cosy and nice hotel in a plesent neigborhood. Friendly staff, clean rooms and a place to return to.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here with kids!”
Reviews.Author: gexin
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our one week stay with kids 8 and 10 years old. We had two small rooms down a small hall. The hall door was closed to give us "adjoining" rooms. We could lean out our windows and see the Eiffel Tower. The rooms had everything we needed. The wireless connection worked great. We were 5 minutes from an RER station, Metro station, bus stop, and taxi stand so it was very easy to get around. We could walk to the Eiffel Tower in 15-20 minutes. The staff really made the place something special. They all spoke English and were very helpful. I highly recommend it and would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It was the friendliest hotel I have ever been to!”
Reviews.Author: adventurous3
Reviews.Content: Ask any questions about the city and you will recieve a precise and helpful answer. It was so pleasent that I already miss being there!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelbuff68
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eiffel Kennedy for 7 nights at the end of December. Very clean, relatively quiet. Staff was very pleasant and friendly and spoke excellent English. Breakfast didn't have tremendous variety but was very tasty. WOW, the room was tiny, though. Being a reasonably priced hotel room in Paris, I expected a small room, but our room was so tiny that with two beds, two persons and two suitcases there was barely enough room to move. Also, the hotel was a little further out from the city center/Eiffel Tower than I expected. At a very fast pace it took a little over 20 minutes to walk to the Eiffel Tower. However, being that far from the tourist hub also means a quieter stay. And we loved the little cafe next to the hotel - we ate there three times!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Parisian Home Base”
Reviews.Author: DJ64_Aust
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eiffel Kennedy for 3 nights with my 2 teenage sons in September 08 and we loved it. The owners and their staff were all very helpful and friendly and couldnt do enough to help us. The hotel is in a quiet area of Paris with easy access to the Metro and all the main attractions. The room was quite small with 3 beds squashed in but it was Paris and we expected it. It was very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was a little expensive but very nice. Airport transfers advice was quite expensive. Roissy Bus is the best transfer into the city, then Metro to Ranelagh from Opera. All in all a fantastic home base for a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place with a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: libearty4g
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Eiffel - Kennedy Hotel from 12/27/08 to 1/1/09. If you're looking for a quiet hotel in a good location and not pay the high prices that you can expect in Paris then this the place for you. I must admit my first impression was I was not impressed with the hotel. Over my stay it did grow on me enough to say I would recommend it to a friend. On the most part the hotel staff is friendly with the day staff being way better then the night. For me the older gentleman who works at night would rather you come in, get your key and don't ask for anything. I'm not saying he was really rude but you could tell he just didn't want to be bothered. If you come in late at night as we did, ask him for ice he just loves that. Ok, sorry inside joke but do ask him. Our room was always clean as for the hotel it self. They have free Internet which makes it nice for communicating back home. I didn't eat the breakfast there. The location is good, your close to all train and bus stations. I did walk back from the Eiffel tower on New Years Eve and it took us around 20 minutes. This was at a very fast pace so if you are just strolling along then plan on about 30 minutes. There are a lot of small restaurants in the area. I can't really recommend any because I only ate at one. There is a small convenience store across the street that I found very useful. This was my first trip to Paris so here are a couple of thing that my help you on your trip. First if you are a soda drinker then forget it in the restaurants of Paris. You will pay on average 5.50 euros for one soda. For me this still blows my mind especially when you can go across the street from the hotel and buy a 1.5L for 1.90 euros. There was one restaurants next to Notre Dame I paid 9.2 euros for one soda. If your looking at the entrance to Notre Dame the restaurant just to the left on the corner is a huge tourist trap, stay away. If your going to Louvre then get there early because the lines do get very long and I do mean long. Same with the Eiffel Tower. All in all my trip to France was good. The Hotel Eiffel - Kennedy helped at to my experience. Don't be afraid to ask the day staff for ideas or directions they are always more then willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice base to explore Paris”
Reviews.Author: Power_2_The_HaveNots
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife stayed at this hotel from 13th July and were there for bastille night 14th July (spectacular time to be in Paris - but extremely busy!). The room was small but we were expecting this due to the previous reviews on tripadvisor and reviews of most hotels in Paris. It was probably all the size you would need if you aren't planning on staying in your room all day - which we definatley weren't! The guy who works on reception at night is a right pain - he was disinterested and didn't want to be talked to too much. However the day staff (i think its the owner and his wife) were fantastic. They were very willing to help and non-critical of my poor french (lol) and spoke in English if we prefered. The breakfast was nice (not too much variety but nice all the same). The restaraunt on the corner beside us had a great view of the eiffel tower from outside however being a vegetarian I found I was able to eat nothing there - and they didnt vary the menu at all while we were there. Found a fantastic veggie restaraunt on the web (La Victoire, SuprÃªme du Coeur) but it was quite a bit away so we got a taxi - but I highly recomend the happy jose burger - amazing!) All in all a good base to visit paris from with a choice of two metro stations (one up the hill and one down the hill). Room was very clean and tidy and noise levels were minimal.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Paris”
Reviews.Author: CGFSD
Reviews.Content: I spent my honeymoon in Paris, and we had a really great time in part because of this excellent hotel and its super nice staff! It is very difficult to find in Paris a 3 star hotel that is clean, in good location and affordable! Me and my husband really recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: RLR2201
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed for 3 nights at the Eiffel Kennedy this summer as part of our 3 week vacation to France. Because we were travelling with two almost teens (12 and 12) we needed a hotel in Paris were we could afford two rooms! After much research we decided upon the Eiffel Kennedy and it was a great decision! The hotel is located outside of the main tourist areas (which in a way is kind of nice). We used the subway to get around and there is a station about 5 minutes from the hotel. Now, don't get fooled by the name, the hotel is a good 20-30 minute walk from the Eiffel tower! When we first arrived at the hotel, I must admit I was a bit surprised as it looked a bit older than what I was expecting. When we got to our rooms, we realised that it was actually meant to looked that way. In our rooms, things looked old but were actually new. The beds were in great shape (two twins) and the amenities were very nice. Now, don't expect a huge room with a gigantic bathroom, afterall this is Paris! The breakfast buffet, served in a small room in the basement, was very nice. All the options were there and, if you couldn't find what you were looking for, the personnel would go to great lengths to meet your needs. Overall, I think the best part of the Eiffel Kennedy was the personnel, from the desk clerk to the woman serving breakfast, everyone was really nice and willing to go the extra mile. Having been in Paris before, this is not a given so kudos to the Eiffel for finding friendly people in a city known for the opposite!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: CatWomanKitty
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel that epitomises all that is good in Paris! Bernard, the owner, was friendly and very helpful. He helped us feel at 'home' as soon as we walked through the door. The room was gorgeous and romantic and if we hung out the French window we had a view of the Eiffel Tower. There is everything you need near by. A laundrette, a supermarket, a Patisserie and a cafe beneath the hotel for cafe au lait and watching the world go by. The room was spotlessly clean and well equipped. We highly recommend this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless!”
Reviews.Author: Happycamper70
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Eiffel Kennedy for a long weekend in October and could not have been happier with the hotel. We had read the positive reviews of the hotel posted on this website and were not dissapointed. The room was clean and elegant, the rate reasonable and the staff very friendly and helpful. Happy to recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Blarnia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights at the end of September and we had interconnecting rooms for ourselves and our 2 children. Rooms were very clean and beds were very comfy. Bathrooms were big and modern and there were minibars in both rooms. Both rooms were air conditioned and the rooms faced towards the river. Staff were SO helpful and lovely, and the breakfast was lovely. We went on to spend another 3 weeks through hotels in Europe and my family still rates their cakes as THE best! Would have no hesitation in staying their again Its walking distance to the Metro, close to the Seine and in a lovely safe part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful....”
Reviews.Author: jpossum
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with our baby daughter. The hotel was very helpful in arranging a cot for our room and there was a high chair in the breakfast area. Every time we went out and needed help with directions etc the staff at the desk would go out of their way to assist. Down side is the neighbour. While it's quite safe it's also a little dull. Overall a most positive experience...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gnome2Travel
Reviews.Content: Paris was a wonderful experience for a first-time visit to celebrate our 32nd wedding anniversary. We stayed one week starting September 16. We would have to attribute our great experience in part to the owners of this lovely family-owned hotel. Our itinerary was ambitious. We wanted to immerse ourselves in the local culture and visits to the amazing museums and other highlights of the city. We could do this because we were able to use the great transportation systems (bus, metro & RER). We could not use the systems without the help of the management. Bernard should have his own Office du Tourisme! I have to disagree with another traveler about the breakfast. We thought it was simply amazing every single morning. The baked goods were fabulous. We look forward to coming back, maybe for our 35th anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “A Three Star Hotel with a Five Star Heart!”
Reviews.Author: Powersay
Reviews.Content: I am very happy to say that our one week stay at the hotel was a very pleasant and enjoyable experience. The hotel is very conveniently situated the center of Paris with easy access to bus and underground train stations. Our room although a tad small, was very cosy and clean, very comfortable to rest in after a day of running around Paris. The reception staff where very helpful in providing us with vital information which helped us make the most of our time, and where never to busy to provide us with assistance at any time of the day. Breakfast was delicious with a wide choice foods to choose from, and again was made even better by the terrific service provided by the hostess. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “We fell in luv with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: luv_birds28
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location for touring and easy reach to shops/bars and 15 minutes walk to the Eiffel Tower. The rooms were basic but adequate. We do not think that we could have found a better hotel with all the search engines we had on the world wide web to search for this hotel. Bernard, the manager was so helpful and kind to us and also others. The night manager was also helpful. We would certainly go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Teri_Jen_Kim
Reviews.Content: My 2 adult daughters and I stayed at this charming hotel for 3 nights. Although the triple room was small, that's how most hotels in Edinburgh/Madrid/Dublin have been for us. The room was clean and had a nice view of the street. The best part was the location - walking distance to the Tower and shopping areas. Good local restaurants too! The staff was amazing. We only speak a few words of French but we were trying so hard. Everyone was helpful and we actually picked up some phrases and words. The staff speak English and that certainly was a plus. We were given outstanding help in using public transportation to the Lourve and Versailles. I can not recommend this hotel any higher!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mukul-IND
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Eiffel Kennedy for 2 nights on 19th Sep and 20th Sep. The hotel is nicely located and is pretty close to both the bus stands, RER station and Metro station. The hotel seems to be pretty old but has been kept clean. I stayed in Room 425 (corner room). The room was too small for my liking but it was OK since I was only there for sleeping over. The toilet and shower room were small and movement inside was pretty limited. The breakfast was just OK. Nothing hot was available except the toast bread and tea. The gentleman at the reception (Bernard and one Indian person) were very good but one lady and another one old person were not too forthcoming. In fact I was wrongly guided by the lady once when asked about directions to Notre dame. I took the bus from the other side and went half way in the wrong direction. The older person also was promoting the Yellow Van taxi service and discouraged me from taking the RER to the airport. He was unable to get me a booking for the taxi service and then I had to take the RER which was pretty ok. However, all travellers who wish to take the RER would need to carry their baggages up and down the stations. Overall the hotel stay was fine. I didn't think it was value for money for 130 EUR per night with breakfast but I guess Paris is like that only.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: geoffsmithnj
Reviews.Content: We had the best stay at the Hotel Eiffel - Kennedy. We booked the room for 3 nights of our Lune de Miele (Honeymoon--the owner surprised us with a bottle of champagne!) and were very happy with our stay. The owner and his wife were very nice and helpful, offering a corkscrew, cuttlery, and directions/recommendations anytime we asked. They also gave us suggestions for places to see on our trip. Very helpful! The hotel is walking distance to the Eiffel tower which is great for day and night photos (a must if you stay here). Also a good location to pick up a bus (the 72) or the metro (2 blocks away). Would recommend to anyone visiting Paris, whether it's your first time (like my wife) or if you've visited a dozen times (like me :-) A+

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience, so bad we couldn't even unpack.”
Reviews.Author: UsualSuspect01
Reviews.Content: Reserved for two people for special birthday stay with view of Eiffel Tower. When we checked in we were given a very tiny single person room that smelled so badly of smoking that we could not even unpack. Small window faced alley wall 3 feet away with no sky visible and hardly any daylight. We were stunned. We immediatly requested another room (offering to pay more). The manager who claimed to be the "owner" refused to provide another room (no availability) and refused to cancel our reservation. When we refused to accept the room he threatened to call the police if we did not provide a physical credit card to pay for the room. We payed for the room and immediatly left to stay at another hotel. We are a nice couple that have stayed in Paris before and understand what is reasonalbe to expect from a moderately priced Paris hotel. This was an awful experience that felt like being mugged. Do yourself a favour and don't stay here. There are so many better choices for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aura_Maria
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I went to Paris for a conference and had the most wonderful time. The Eiffel Kennedy is a small but very nice hotel. Thereâ€™s a computer with internet connection in the lobby and internet in the rooms. The rooms and bathrooms are very clean. The service is outstanding; the staff is helpful and extremely friendly. They all speak English and some even speak Spanish. Definitely would come back

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel in a nice area”
Reviews.Author: OptomAbroad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July 2008 for 5 nights at the end of 4 weeks in Europe. It's in a good location, close to Maison Radio France. It's about 15 mins walk to the Eiffel Tower, near a metro and RER station, and there is a bus (Number 72) along the Seine that will take you to Eiffel tower, Place de la Concorde, Muse de Orsay, Louvre, and Notre Dame. The hotel has small rooms, but this is Paris! I have stayed in a couple of awful places in Paris that were not much cheaper. We both think this Hotel is great value for money, with excellent friendly staff. The rooms were very clean and serviced daily, nice flat screen TVs and it was great to have CNN and BBC in English to catch up on the news. The rooms were Air-conditioned and quiet which is important to us as we are light sleepers. There are couple of small shops nearby which were handy for things for breakfasts. The hotel breakfast was very nice, but as we don't eat much early in the morning we only tried it once. The hotel is in a good residential area, and there is a restaurant not too far away on Rue de Passy called Aero which I can recommend. (There is a Mcdonalds beside it if you really have too!) We would highly recommend this hotel to travelers and visitors, and we would stay there again even if it wasn't convenient to where we were arriving or departing from.

Reviews.Title: “Fab 4 Family of Five”
Reviews.Author: Family5Perth
Reviews.Content: We were a family of five staying in Paris for a few nights and we chose this hotel for its location and its ability to accommodate our family in two adjoining rooms. Our rooms were connected by a small corridor which had a lockable door allowing us to move freely between each, day and night without locking our individual room doors. One room had three single beds for our three children aged 10,11 and 13 years and the other room had a double bed. We were all very excited by the fact that we could see the top of the Eiffel Tower out of our windows! The rooms were small but clean. We also found the staff very helpful and enjoyed the restaurants around the area very much. There is also a Laundromat across the road which is very handy. We loved this area, as although it is only about a 15 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, it is not particularly a touristy area. It is also conveniently located within easy walking distance to several train stations. We thought that this was a great choice to stay within this price range and would happily recommend it to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Hotel Staff”
Reviews.Author: MikeKwan
Reviews.Content: The room is small but it will be the same case in other hotels with similar rating in downtown Paris. The price is higher than the ones in USA, Hong Kong, Berlin or even Helsinki but this is the problem of Paris, not particular to this hotel. In fact, the price of Eiffel Kennedy is relatively reasonable. The important thing is the software - the staff. The hotel staff is extremely friendly and helpful. I have stayed for 3 days and met several staff members - all of them are very friendly! Another important thing in Paris is to find a clean area to stay. The hotel itself and the surrounding area are clean and tidy which should not be taken for granted in Paris. The accessibility of the hotel is good. Within 5 minutes walk to Metro station and 20 minutes leisure walk to Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: exdumpling
Reviews.Content: Staff were extremely friendly and helpful, even though we didn't speak French. Hotel is in a nice, safe, quiet area only a few blocks walk from a Metro station. Rooms were clean and had air conditioning (a rarity in Paris). I disagree with other reviewers who say that the rooms are too tiny... Yes, the rooms are a bit small compared to standard U.S. hotel rooms, but they're bigger than cruise ship rooms, for example. The rooms were plenty big enough for my husband and I with all our luggage. In summary, I would definitely stay in the Hotel Eiffel Kennedy again if I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: mdogs
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel after reading the excellent reviews on trip advisor. the reception staff were so friendly and helpful, they were more than happy to help organise our airport shuttles, restaurants for dinner and point out some of the local places nearby. the location was excellent with views of the eiffel tower within a minutes walk from the hotel. there were lots of restaurants, bars, laundry, bakeries etc all around. the rooms were a little small but extremely nice and comfortable! our room had a nice tv, airconditioning, a decent sized bathroom, mini bar etc. If i go back to paris i would definately stay here again, it was a fantastic hotel and would recommend this to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: TORPIFIED
Reviews.Content: Room: Positives: very good size for Parisian standards, great maid service, great air conditioning unit, good water pressure in shower, great view through window (street view)...you don't need the air conditioning if you can sleep with the window open, but you have to be able to withstand the noise of cars, horns, and above all, scooters. Fantastic wireless internet service in each room. Ask front desk for password. Negatives: windows are decent but not really soundproof, walls are relatively thin so you can hear running water and footsteps of neighbours. Staff: Very helpful and friendly. No negatives here. The maid staff are absolutely great as well. Clean sheets and bathroom daily. Location: The BEST. Cafe right at the bottom of the hotel. Relatively calm, residential area with plenty of markets, a boulangerie right across the street, plenty of cafes/bistros, and a metro within a five minute walk. Open market every Tuesday and Friday across the street. Seine river, two minutes away, which makes for a great walk at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location”
Reviews.Author: Kiwigal000
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple room because we were travelling with our teenage daughter. The central location was very good - a short walk to the river Seine, about 15 minute walk to Eiffel Tower, and a shopping centre about 10 minutes walk away. The buffet breakfast was very nice, including french cakes! The reception staff spoke English, and the Manager was friendly and helpful. The hotel was very clean. There was free use of a laptop and the internet. Our room was extremely small for three people - there were three single beds pushed together with very little space around the sides. The beds and pillows were not very comfortable - the worst on our one month Europe trip. They need new ones! The thing I disliked most though was that the room was very stuffy and smelled of stale cigarette smoke. The walls were covered in fabric, not wallpaper, and it seemed to have absorbed the smell of previous smoker occupants. I asked for a non-smoking room, but from what I gathered there is no such thing. Perhaps some rooms smelled better than ours though if they had not recently been occupied by a smoker? But overall we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Irene42
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Paris on Bastille Day and the celebrations were fantastic. We arrived at the Hotel a little early and Bernard gave us a wonderful welcome and we asked him where we could have lunch and he recommended the Cafe La Fontaine which was excellent. When we returned to the hotel our room was ready with a beautiful view of the Eiffel Tower and our bags were already in the room. A lovely gesture! Our room was excellent, with excellent soundproofing, air-conditioning, and a lovely bathroom. It was also extremely pleasant that our bedlinen was changed each day with new towels fantastic!!!! Bernard and Simone are absolutely lovely and even helped us develop our poor French and were very patient with our attempts. Nothing is a problem to them and they are wonderful hosts. We really enjoyed the area as we were near to all the sights and we used the no 72 bus which runs right along the Seine and was recommended by Bernard. We also explored the area and found some nice shops on Avenue de Mozart with some lovely cafes and great Croque Monsieur! Two nights was not long enough and we have no hesitation in recommending this hotel as we will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: llanedi
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel, we stayed for 3 nights the staff were wonderful ,the breakfast lovely and the hotel is within walking distance of the effiel tower. Yes the room are a little small but had a/c and flat screen television and very very clean. We would certainly stay there again next time we are in Paris. There are some lovely resturants close by that were recommended by the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay with Children”
Reviews.Author: LMCTHAU
Reviews.Content: Our perfect 3 day stay started with a warm welcome from the owner, who gave us a map of Paris with tips on the most convenient bus (72), metro and train (RER C). We had 2 separate rooms (213-214), connected by a small corridor, which could be closed and locked. It was a great set up for 2 adults and 2 children, with their own bathroom and privacy. The view on the tip of the Eiffel tower was a plus. The hotel was immaculate with a charming breakfast room in the basement. There was an exceptional variety of food, mostly baked and cooked by the owner's wife. This hotel high rating on Trip Advisor is well deserved and offers excellent value for money. I know where to stay next time we come to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet area in a good location of Paris”
Reviews.Author: misstravelbug-uk
Reviews.Content: Booked a triple room here for a long weekend in May. We arrived in from the eurostar and took the metro. The hotel is about a 5-7 min walk from the metro station through pleasant residential streets. The location was quite convenient, with a great bus route that passes through many tourist spots. Our checkin with the concierge went very smoothly. The front desk was so friendly and helpful with tips and advice. We followed their advice for dinner recommendation one night and it was great! The hotel is about a 20min walk to the Eiffel tower, very lovely stroll during good weather. The room itself was too small, the triple beds fit side by side to become one big bed. That was not comfortable. There was hardly any room for 3 people to put their luggage in the room. Also sharing the one key between 3 ppl created some hassle even though the key was to be left at the front desk when leaving so it wasn't too much of a bother. Having keycard entry may have been more convenient. The bathroom itself was very large and there was a flat screen tv mounted on the wall. Overall, would recommend this hotel for the price and location, though for triple room it is definitely on the small side, even for european standards.

Reviews.Title: “The Eiffel Kennedy Hotel is a treasure!”
Reviews.Author: cgolfgeek
Reviews.Content: I booked a 6 day stay at the Eiffel Kennedy Hotel for myself and two teenage children. I choose this hotel because of its location and the fact that I wanted my children to experience the charm of a smaller hotel nestled in a neighborhood. My hopes were surpassed in every respect. We stayed in a snug triple with windows that opened to flowering geraniums and a view of the Eiffel Tower. Even though we were in a neighborhood, it is but a short walk to excellent transportation. The hotel staff gave us wonderful directions and were very kind to my family. The neighborhood surrounding the hotel provided a feast for our picnics as we would stop at the bakery and fruit stand to purchase supplies for our many picnics. There is a lovely park steps away from the hotel that was a favorite retreat. In short, the Hotel Eiffel Kennedy is a treasure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fazoolynj
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Eiffel Kennedy for two nights and was very pleased. Keeping in mind that this is a European hotel, the rooms were quite small as was the shower, however, the kindness of the staff was overwhelming. Simone and Anais (not quite sure of the spelling) were so helpful and knowledgeable of the area and were quick and willing to help, even when my rented global cell phone would not work! The Eiffel Kennedy is amazingly close to the Eiffel Tower and so many of Paris' main attractions, and is in a very nice neighborhood. Many thanks for an all too short but wonderful stay. I would definitely stay at this hotel when visiting Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Value!”
Reviews.Author: Patar
Reviews.Content: Parisians are known to be less than cordial to Americans. Not so at this hotel! The front desk staff spoke English willingly, and went out of their way to give us directions and little tips on touring. They even have various tourist books (Frommer's, etc) in the lobby for people to use! We arrived early in the morning, having taken an overnight train. Our room was ready and we were able to check in! The room was clean and comfortable. Since we were traveling with our daughter, we booked a triple, which was a room with three twin beds. There is a coffee shop next door, a bakery across the street, and a market with plenty of fresh fruit about 1/2 block away. The room had a mini-bar with a little extra room in the refrigerator, so we were able to store fruit there. My husband ate the hotel breakfast each day at a cost of $10 EU, but my daughter and I preferred to shop the neighborhood stores and ate much cheaper. The location is a good - about a three block walk to the subway and RER train station. The number 72 bus stops about 2 blocks away. That bus goes right past the Eiffel Tower and the Louvre. You can find newer hotels and fancier hotels, but if you want great service and good value for your money, the Hotel Eiffel Kennedy has it!

Reviews.Title: “The Excellent Reviews Are True”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer1610
Reviews.Content: We booked a weekend break to Paris with BA and chose this hotel based on the reviews on this site. We were delighted with this hotel. We were given a warm welcome, given loads of maps and travel advice and they even booked a minibus to take us to the airport. Our room had a new Samsung LCD TV, the bathroom was clean and well-lit and the breakfast was great. They have free wi-fi and a PC in the lobby for guests to use and print from. Even the bar next door, Cafe La Fontaine, was lovely, even if the drinks were a tad pricey but that seemed to be par for the course in Paris The location is great, there are plenty of restaurants in walking distance, the Metro (Ranelagh, Line 9) and RER (Kennedy Radio France, Line C) and Eiffel Tower are also in walking distance. We will definitely stay here again. C'est manifique!

Reviews.Title: “Very good little hotel”
Reviews.Author: JS101
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading other reviews on this site and were not disappointed so would recommend this hotel to others. On arrival the lady on reception was very helpful-she gave us a map straight away and gave us a few pointers. All the other staff we met were friendly and helpful. Reception staff all spoke good English. The room itself was smallish but was comfortable and a reasonable standard for a 3 star hotel. Breakfast (an extra EUR10) was a very good buffet-the usual sort of European breakfast fare but also some very tasty homemade cakes ! The hotel within 5 mins of Metro line 9 and RER line C and 10 mins of Metro line 6. The area itself is a lovely residential area with quite a few restaurants and several shops. It's just far enough away from the tourist hustle and bustle but close enough to easily get to the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Words Cannot Express”
Reviews.Author: Lo_N_Bowmanville
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Paris. My parents had been the previous year and told us how Europe was very different from Canada. I fell in love with the Hotel Eiffel Kennedy it was in a perfect location walking distance to the Eiffel Tower and the metro and trains. The Hotel Staff was very friendly and helpful. I couldn't have asked for more. The rooms were alwasy very clean and this was the cutest hotel I have ever seen. Rooms are smaller than North American Hotels but I didn't care. There was a cafe downstairs that had the best Cafe Creme. I want to thank Simone and her Staff for making our vacation one of the best... It was so great that we are planning to Return for our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this small, cosy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Teresa040
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a weekend in the Hotel Eiffel-Kennedy in Paris and would highly recommend the hotel for anyone looking for a good 3 star. The four of us booked two twin rooms, located on the top floor. They were small but clean and cosy. Each with a mini-bar, flat-screen tv, air-conditioning etc. The breakfast had a good selection of bread, croissants, quiches, meat, eggs, and various sweet cakes which seem to be so popular on the continent. The small breakfast room is in the cellar of the building and has lots of character. We also found the staff in the hotel to be friendly and helpful. There is a lovely little restaurant beside the hotel (CafÃ© A La Fontaine) which serves a good variety of food and drink and has lots of atmosphere. There were also a couple of other nice restaurants in the area - notably L'Onde where prices were reasonable and the food and service excellent. This is a quiet area of Paris - appeared to be mainly residential but it is close to two RER stations, not far from the Eiffel Tower and in walking distance of the centre of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Staff!!! Will go back there!”
Reviews.Author: ichoi
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. A small hotel right in the middle of Paris, near metro station (Radio Kennedy, line B). Reasonable price. In nice, quite neighbourhood. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms are well heated, although they are a bit small. Breakfast was ok, â‚¬10 was a bit expensive, but we had not much choice since we went to Paris on Christmas Day. In short, the staff attitude was excellent, much better than most higher class hotels! I will recommend this to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “About what we expected”
Reviews.Author: fsdiss
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and in a good location. The bed was a bit uncomfortable and the breakfast was skimpy. The front desk people were really helpful and nice and we had a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very central and nice hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: KerstinBonn
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our trip to Paris and loved this little hotel. Rooms are small but very clean. We just had breakfast once (was o.k. but not worth the 10 Euro) but preferred our coffee in the little very nice restaurant right next to the hotel. The situation of the hotel is excellent. You can walk to the Eiffel tower in about 15 minutes and also the bus took us everywhere. The staff was very helpful and friendly! Would recommend the hotel for a short trip to Paris. Kerstin

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service at Hotel Eiffel Kennedy”
Reviews.Author: Richard Q
Reviews.Content: After a beautiful flight from Montreal QuÃ©bec Canada to Paris France, on Air Canada I was victim of a rather negative experience. (pickpocketed) When we got to the Eiffel Kennedy what a surprise, Mr. Bernard the hotel owner really gave us a good hand with all of the calls to do to cancel credit card and debit card. He was very helpful with all kinds of hints on what next to do such as Â»Police Report and gave us directions to the Â»Police headquarters. The minute he started to help us the pressure just came down, and we had a wonderful experience at this hotel. He was always there to help us and to suggest a nice little cafÃ© especially CafÃ© Antoine or the one next door CafÃ© A La Fontaine. He's a wonderful Concierge for his customers. As a matter of fact all the staff are very helpful, polite, patient and very respectful. The breakfast were also very good, French Petit DÃ©jeuner, Jocelyne is a great breakfast maker and does a prompt service always with a smile and a helpful comment on what you are planning for the day. The breakfast dining room is typical, and very charming. Our room was nicely decorated and very charming, and the bathroom was of a good reasonnable size and all was always very clean. Simone at the Front desk is very helpful and does all to help so you will have a wonderful stay at the hotel. All in all we had a wonderful stay at Hotel Eiffel Kennedy and the location is also very nice. We're very pleased with all the services. We would recommend very highly.

Reviews.Title: “What a great, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: kaymclou
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel on the 25th to the 27th of April. We selected this hotel because of the comments made on trip advisor and it must be noted that most of them are very true! The hotel staff are very friendly and very willing to give you advice on where to go and how to get there. One instance was when the receptionist told us that it is very convenient to get the number 72 bus which takes you right along the river and past all the main sites. The hotel resided in a residential area of Paris which felt very safe for the 3 of us, all women. We were walking around some of the back streets from a near by metro station about 10.30pm and never felt threatened, in fact all we actually saw was people jogging around that area. We had a double room, with an extra bed, which was an adequate size for the 3 of us. Some would consider it slightly on the small side, but we only slept in the room and nothing else, so the size was never an issue! The only downside was that the hotel room never had tea making facilities but we brought our own kettle so again not a problem! The bathroom was a surprise! After looking at several other hotels bathrooms we had just resigned to the fact that bathrooms in Paris are tiny, but our bathroom was a great size, it never felt cramped, in fact it was just a perfect size! A great bonus of this hotel is that it has a restaurant/cafe/bar attached to it, very friendly waiters and serve food until really late at night! However, the downside of this is that because of the area you are in all the menus are in French! But when we asked the waiter to interpret he was very helpful. One tip, donâ€™t ask for a bottle of house wine they charge you Â£17 Pretty expensive! Also right across from the hotel is a patisserie that sells lovely croissants and baguette sandwiches, a chemist, supermarkets that are very handy to buy food for picnics. One other thing that is quite important is that the hotel is very close to main RER stations and metro stations. We got the RER from Porte Maillot to Kennedy/Radio France station, and then it was about a 5 mins walk to the hotel. We then used â€˜Javelâ€™ RER across the bridge to get to all the main sites, for example Notre Dam, Louvre etc, and also to get to Versailles â€“ on that point everyone MUST go and see the ChÃ¢teau of Versailles, one of the most spectacular things I have ever seen! We did not eat breakfast in the hotel, so unfortunately we cannot comment on this. All in all a FANTASTIC holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful four nights at the Eiffel Kennedy”
Reviews.Author: Traveller016
Reviews.Content: I booked a four night stay in Paris with my family, we arrived very late on the Thursday night and recieved a warm welcome. Yes the rooms are very small, but this was no surprise bearing in mind the price and we hardly spent any time in the bedroom so we did not mind. The most wonderful aspect of this hotel is how consistantly friendly the staff are - everyone of them greets you with a smile and remembers who you are and where you have been. We were very impressed with the breakfast, which started our day off really well. We were all very pleasantly impressed by the change of linen, our sheets and towels were changed everyday which is above the expectations of a three star hotel. If you are looking for a great location - 20 minutes walk from Batobus (river taxi) which is such a relaxed way to explore the city and a warm welcome with a great breakfast you cannot go far wrong by booking this lovely hotel. We shall certainly be returning.... Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: kellymic
Reviews.Content: The Eiffel Kennedy is a very nice place to stay. The owner and his lovely wife make you feel right at home. It is close to the Metro and located within walking distance to the Eiffel Tower. We will stay again when in Paris, Merci beaucoup!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with the cosy "cafe la fontaine" downstairs.”
Reviews.Author: viking0
Reviews.Content: We enjoyd a 4 day stay at this cosy & friendly hotel. Great receptioen staff.. very friendly and englisk speaking. Good rooms with clean bath and plenty of towels. We got upgraded to two doubel rooms, instead of the two singel we paid for. Good breakfast deal.. in the very small breakfast room in the cellar..but friendly service. The great thing about hotel eiffel kennedy is the area "Passy" 5 min from the hotel, perfect for shopping.. evrything on the same street = Passy. But the real hit about the hotel Eiffel Kennedy is that "cafe la fontaine" is connected to the hotel ( aorund the corner).. where you can sit and enjoy the street life, and the relaxed paris settings. Actually you can see a photo hanging in the receptionen, showing the excact same scenery 100 year ago.. Not much have changed in hotel Eiffel kennedy.. except for the name, in the old days the name was Hotel La fontaine. great value and thanks for a nice easter stay from "mom and son from Denmark.

Reviews.Title: “to bad about the room size.”
Reviews.Author: mollyann500
Reviews.Content: I have read all the reviews for this hotel and it is well liked by travelers. But I want to warn everyone of the room sizes. Yes I know rooms in Paris tend to be small however the room we were give was so tiny that we could not stay there. In order for both of us to enter the room with our luggage, one of us had to get on the bed. No closet, no in room safe, tiny bathroom. No dresser to unpack luggage. We went back to the front desk to request a bigger room and where told all rooms in Paris are this size. I have been to Paris many times and always stayed in a 3 star hotels and while small they were bigger then this tiny room. We left our luggage in the room long enough to find another hotel. We moved as that room was far too small for a 6 day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay at a jewel of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: NovaScotiaMary
Reviews.Content: Traveling with two teenagers and needing a triple room worried me when I booked, as it caused limited selection in hotels in my price range. My concern was unwarranted: we were thrilled with all aspects of our stay at the Eiffel-Kennedy. First, Bernard, Justine and Simone were so gracious, sensitive, responsive and helpful they put us at ease and gave us terrific tips and assistance, whether for directions, eating establishments, or anything at all. Secondly, the gourmet breakfasts, often emerging from family recipes for special cakes, and pastries, were gastronomic delights, as well as generous, and provided a great start to the days. The location was a short walk to metros, bus, taxi stand, and reasonably priced delicious local restaurants. We stayed 9 nights, and clean up was timely and thorough. The room was sound proof, as promised, and hot water never ran out! The location was safe, the beds, comfortable, the elevator very useful, especially with bags at the end of the trip. The hotel was great value for the cost, and the experience, in my mind, warranted five stars!! I'll be recommending it to everyone and we'll be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “this is a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: goodinson
Reviews.Content: this hotel is great i would recommend it to any one .we stayed there for two nights it is in walking distance of the eiffel tower or one metro stop if you dont want to walk ! at the end of the road is the statue of liberty and there are lots of restaurant around the hotel . the staff are very friendly and helpful and the breakfast is very good value for money . we had a veiw of the effiel tower from our room witch at night looks stunning .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic find!”
Reviews.Author: WSandy
Reviews.Content: We took our chances and booked our stay here through British Air when we bought the plane tickets. Yes the room was tiny, but the beds were comfortable and the bathroom big and clean. The staff could not have been nicer or more helpful. And the breakfast was completely amazing! Fabulous coffee (such a treat after a week of awful coffee in London), an incredible array of pastries, croissants, baguettes, cakes, tarts, fruit, yogurt, cereal... And all homemade and everything delicious. For extra cost you could order eggs or an omlette, but we were very pleased with everything that was included. The location is away from the main sites, but in a neighborhood with a very homey, friendly feel to it. Lots of people walking dogs, lots of people with kids, etc. When we had dinner nearby, we were the only Americans each time, and that was great, we felt we really got a taste of the local scene. Great shopping is nearby. There's a bank machine right across the street, as well as a great bakery and nice convenience store. Bus #72 is a few blocks and the 20 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower is on a pedestrian walkway in the middle of the Seine, it's fabulous! Can't recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable,Clean and Accessible”
Reviews.Author: inkatraveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 9 day holiday in Paris and had a wonderful stay at this small and comfortable hotel. The hotel is located adjacent to Radio France and a couple of blocks away from the Seine with a train station and a Metro station within walking distance. Rooms are small and furnished with a small desk and chair ,a mini bar, a couple of night stands and a flat panel tv set with CNN and BBC as the only english language channels. Bathrooms, though small, are equipped with a shower/tub combination, sink, toilet ,floor heater and hair drier. Our room faced the street (3rd floor) and despite all the noise below (trash collection, car horns...) when the windows were open, we were able to sleep peacefully because of their sound proof windows. The hotel offers an optional breakfast for 10 Euros/day which I think is a bargain compared to the place down the street "Les Ondes brasserie" where a cup of coffee. a slice of ham, a croissant and a small baguette would cost you 8.5 Euros. We enjoyed a tart du jour,fresh croissant, fruits (fresh and canned) yogurt, cheeses, ham,cereals, coffee, tea and freshly prepared egg dishes everyday. Owners and hotel personnel are friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: kakkar_manish
Reviews.Content: Hi All, We came to know of this hotel from Trip Advisor and booked it Online. The hotel, though small, was an excellent home away from home. It was worth spending the money. The people at the reception were really warm people and helped us in deciding and planning the trip/visits. They really made us feel comfortable. We stayed there from December 11 till December 13,(with wife and kid). The hotel was at 15 minutes walking distance from Eiffel Tower. Furthermore, it is very well connected to the main attractions of Paris. There is also an Indian Resturant nearby which offers vegetarian food as well. The breakfast offered at the hotel was also very good. Only downside is that they do not have a bell boy for assistance with luggage. Overall, it is one of the best hotels in 3 star category. I strongly recommend this place to all, who are planning to travel to Paris with family. Manish Kakkar New Delhi, India kakkar_manish@yahoo.co.in

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Bernard ...”
Reviews.Author: ANGELA,GREECE
Reviews.Content: We did book two triple rooms for three nights... to be honest we did stay after two days in Disneyland and two suites there (around 60sm) so the rooms did look to us smallâ€¦ But the people there are really friendly and the breakfast lovely... So if you do not mind about the size you will like this place really much â€¦ A good place to stay in Paris â€¦

Reviews.Title: “A friendly place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Ontario_Canada_Jane
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend this hotel for a stay in Paris. Taxi from CDG airport for 4 people costs about 50 Euros. Extremely friendly owners and staff (especially Bernard's wife). Quiet and safe location. Customary to hand in your key to the front desk when you go out for the day. Walking distance to restaurants, stores, and the Eiffel Tower. Extremely nice boulangerie/bakery across the street. One block from a taxi stand (but don't stand at the covered taxi stop on the same side as the hotel because we were told that taxis never stop there! Go to the one across the street and down one block). We did not take the metro at this location, but it is very easy to get around Paris with! Average size, clean rooms which are pleasantly decorated. The beds are really comfortable and soft. The day that we left, flat-screen televisions were being installed in the rooms. Lots of space in the bathrooms which are meticulously cleaned. On one of the days we had the breakfast. It was delicious and quite worth the money. Free access to internet in the lobby. One day there was a little market across the road. Would definitely stay in this hotel again! We miss Paris already!

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: Raks77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a residential area but at the same time near the sightseeing places. The rooms were small but nicely decorated and comfortable - better than the other European 3 star hotels I stayed in. The bath was a bit small but then most single room ones are. My parents were in a double room which had a good size loo with a tub. The breakfast was awesome infact one of the things I loved about the place and the staff was unfailingly curtious, helpful and friendly. The hotel has a computer, in the lobby area, connected to the net which you can use free of charge which was a nice bonus. The metro is a few minutes away as is the taxis stand so transportation was never a problem. People, in general, were helpful - all we had to do was say hello in french and once they realized we were making an effort to communicate in their lingo they recipocated and helped us out :).

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful, clean rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: Chalfont
Reviews.Content: The hotel Eiffel Kennedy is located in an elegant, quiet, safe area of Paris, about 20 mins walk from the Eiffel tower. Excellent bus and RER/Metro links make it easy to get into and, just as importantly at the end of the day, out of the city centre. If you walk out of the hotel and turn right up the hill you will walk through some peaceful and typically Parisien streets - a lovely way to unwind after the hustle and bustle of the city. The hotel room we had was a bit small, although I believe this is normal for Paris, but it was spotless and very comfortable. The staff are all extremely helpful and friendly which is something that you certainly don't always experience in Paris! The hotel had its share of those ignorant, inconsiderate, uncivilised guests who bang doors and talk loudly while preparing for bed, but that is not the hotel's fault. Overall, this hotel is a very safe bet in a very unpredictable city. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Met my expectations”
Reviews.Author: lsasocalifornia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The room is small, which is typical in Paris, but the room is very clean. The hotel is located in a good neighborhood and a very nice 15 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. Definitely recommend the Eiffel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: andyswlondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel the night of the England France Rugby World Cup semi final, which we went to ! This Hotel is really nice, clean, smart and very comfortable. Our twin room wasn't big but more than adequate, bathroom was immaculate. It's in a lovely area of Paris not far from the Eiffel tower and the Brasserie on the corner (shown in their web site picture) was also excellent. Great steak fun lunch on Saturday and we missed breakfast at the Hotel on Sunday (no surprise there) and had brunch sitting on their pavement tables at the brasserie as well.......also excellent. My advice is book this place, I'd go again. Forgot to mention v.helpful and friendly staff !

Reviews.Title: “Just The Tops”
Reviews.Author: oldshep
Reviews.Content: Although now October my wife and I, who are retired along with another retired couple from the UK, all stayed at this hotel for 5 nights Aug.16-20 2007. My wife and I have only just returned home to NZ. This Hotel, which I booked primarily because of the TripAdvisor reviews did not disappoint. It met all our expectations; clean good sized comfortable rooms with en-suites and a breakfast 'par excellence' It is ideally situated for Metro, RER & Bus services and only 20 mins. walk to the Eiffel Tower. . The staff were most pleasant and helpful and the owner and his wife were just superb in assisting and advising as required. We don't think you will find a better Hotel at the price with all the amenities above mentioned. To top it all the Hotel offers free use of a PC for Internet. All four of us agreed that if we ever return to Paris, which is more than likely for our friends from England, we would almost certainly book in at the Eiffel Kennedy again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - Amazing hotelliers”
Reviews.Author: giles36
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel and I would stay here again anytime they could have me . Bernard and his wife are awesome . The rooms are small but beautifully appointed, and there is every consideration given to their guests - the service is A 111111111 class - these guys are a class act, and the staff are great, really helpful. Im looking forward to my next visit, next year. Giles Peterson

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kellerina
Reviews.Content: My sister & I stayed at this hotel the last week of September, 2007. It's a wonderful and quaint hotel at an exceptional value. Simone and Bernard were very helpful to us. This was my first trip to Paris and we had done quite a bit of research to find the right hotel. I was very pleased with our choice! The hotel is spotless. The room was cozy and comfortable... yes, small but who cares! It's also in a very convenient location. There's great shopping right around the corner. Wonderful bakeries and cafes next door. The metro & RER are close by. Also, it's a lovely walk from the hotel to the Eiffel Tower. I look forward to my next visit there!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: ThreeFromVancouver
Reviews.Content: The Eiffel Kennedy is a nice hotel. We stayed there for five nights. It's fairly convenient to the major sights, linked by the RER primarily. That made it pretty easy to get to from the CDG airport. At night, we found few of the RER C trains run back to that area, so we did lots of walking. It's about 2.5 km to the Eiffel Tower - quite a nice walk along the river. The hotel has a lift, which we certainly appreciated, although only one person and one big bag will fit inside at a time. The room we were in (on the third floor) really wasn't made to have three people in it. The three small single beds were all pushed right together, and there was almost no other free space in the room. But, it was pretty quiet, very clean, and well managed. The bathroom was fairly large and again very clean. The tub/shower was a little odd, but it all worked. Staff were helpful and professional. The breakfast is an extra 10 Euros per person. The breakfast room is pretty small, so it can fill up easily. Their breakfast Is mostly made up of cakes and other dessert types of items, so we only did that once.

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Tee11
Reviews.Content: We took the RER and metro from the airport and found it surprisingly easy. You need RER line B to gare du nord and its well signposted. On arrival at Ranelagh, the nearest metro to the hotel we asked at the information desk and the attendant explained the way to the hotel. It's only a 5 minute walk. We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights in late august and it was very quiet. We only encountered 2 other guests, once, in the reception area. After reading reviews and after prior experience in Paris we expected the rooms to be very small, however ours was good in size in comparison to others we have stayed in. The bathroom was very clean and well equiped. The staff were all very friendly and happy to help with any queries. We stayed on a room only basis although the breakfast did look very good. The location of the hotel, for us could not be any better. We enjoyed the brief walk down to the eiffel tower, which took about 25-30 minutes. There aren't many restaurants near the hotel as the area is residential, however, as mentioned the nearest metro is only a brief walk away and the latin quarter is a short journey. There you will find lots to choose from. There are also a few near the eiffel tower. Other attractions such as the Louvre, Arc de Triomphe and Montmartre area are also only a few stops away. Overall, we enjoyed our experience of Paris and would definetly recomand this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotek in quiet surroundings”
Reviews.Author: Okiri
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eiffel-Kennedy hotel from Friday till Sunday (August 24-26). Here are the main conclusions: 1-Small but very clean rooms 2-Very kind and helpful staff 3-Location is good for those who want a quiet area, not in the centre of thingsâ€¦ 4-Reasonable price And to clarify here is our detailed experience. We arrived by car from outside Paris and found it easily. When we were unsure we phoned the hotel and got a clear guidance from the kind receptionist. We arrived a little early (about 12:30) and asked to leave our luggage at the hotel. Fortunately one of our rooms was ready so they let us put the suitcases there. We were traveling with 3 young children. We got two rooms next to each other. No connecting door. Both rooms were very tiny. The rooms for the children had a folding bed in, next to the double bed. Plenty of towels, some better quality then others. The rooms were bright and nice, very clean with flowers on the window seal, which gave it a really nice atmosphere. With some effort we were able to spot the Eiffel tower from one of the rooms. The Hotel staff was very kind and helpful. They helped us get a good rate for the airport shuttle since we were 10 altogether (please be warned that if you do not fill a taxi they will stop at other hotels to collect more people). At the check out they thought we used some chips and peanuts that were placed in the room (mind you, one would have thought those were complimentary, but apparently they are not). Since we denied ever using them it was deducted from the bill with no argument. On our first day we tried to find some restaurants in the evening. But this is not a good place for restaurants. There were only 3-4 within a reasonable walking distance. We ended up at an Italian restaurant which was excellent (visit cards at the reception). On our last day (and on our way to the airport) we decided to go for the hotel's breakfast â€“ which was really nice. Pies and quiches, cakes and hard boiled eggs, bread and toasts, baguette, corn flakes, butter, cheese yogurts, juice, coffee, tea and chocolate for the kids etc. We paid 10 Euros per adult and a reduced price for our older child. The two young children were free. For an additional charge you could have fried eggs and bacon, for example. But we were quite please with the egg & bacon pie. Pros: Service, cleanliness, nearby supermarket, price Cons: Location isn't that good. It's about 20-30 minutes walk to the Eiffel tower. About 7-10 minutes walk to the nearest Metro (Ranelagh). No restaurants choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: logan33961
Reviews.Content: Our room is a little bit small but it was cozy, overlooking Eiffel tower, accomodating staffs. Elevator is very small, Excellent breakfast, its a 20 minutes walk to Eiffel tower. Bus is 5 minutes walk to go to the tower. I felt very safe to walk in the evening. I would recommend this to my family. Its was a Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: THender636
Reviews.Content: Out stay at the Eiffel Kennedy was very enjoyable and we would not hesitate to book a room again on our next visit to Paris. We found the hotel location to be in a nice area of the city, not too busy and yet not far from the city's major attractions. The location was very convenient to bus, train, and metro as well. We found excellent restaurants, shops, a farmer's market, and cash machines close by the hotel. The rooms were European in size, nicely appointed and quite clean. We enjoyed being close to the city without the noise found in many other close-in hotels. The hotel is owned an operated by a local family and they do an exceptional job of taking care of their guests. Any information required or recommendations we sought were quickly satisfied by the knowledgable staff at the front desk. Overall, the staff were very effective and pleasant. Another highlight for the hotel is the breakfast prepared and served under the direction of the owner's wife. The breakfast buffet had a variety of delightful dishes and was well worth the additional cost of 10 euros. Thank you Bernard for the great experience during our stay!

Reviews.Title: “good value ofr money”
Reviews.Author: eveirg
Reviews.Content: Good value for the money, a fab veiw of the Eiffel Tower by the bridge.(just down the road). A pleasent walk along the river, to the Eiffel Tower, and other attractions. Very helpful reception staff, rooms basic- but clean and tidy, a pleasent stay for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Eiffel Kennedy is the best!!!!”
Reviews.Author: morne2454
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eiffel Kennedy Hotel between the 11th and 20th of July and had a wonderful time. Bernard and his spouse were absolutely great - friendly and always willing to help with directions and ideas for visits. We will always remember them. It was our first time in Paris and they made us feel welcome at all times. We will definitely recommend the hotel to all our friends and family and when visiting Paris again will make it our home. Morne and Derek Cape Town, South-Africa

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tracie1000
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Paris with a group of work mates. The hotel service was excellent and friendly. The rooms were very clean and met our needs. Nothing was too much trouble and we were given lots of advice on what to see how to travel and where to go. We were all delighted with our stay wand will be going back for sure Tracey Codling

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with Character and a Smile!”
Reviews.Author: Paris31
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Eiffel Kennedy Hotel in Paris. What a wonderful experience!
