The hotel has tremendous character and charm and is so conveniently situated in terms of sight seeing and shopping. More importantly than this though, was the fantastic friendly and professional attitude of all the staff at the hotel. Always at the ready with advice regarding the best options for transport / restaurants / sightseeing and in fact suggesting some things we had not even planned in our initial itinery! We had such a wonderful stay in such a fantastic hospitable and warm environment and hope that we can return to visit very soon. Thank you so much for a fabulous time! Linda and Werner

Reviews.Title: “So helpful & friendly”
Reviews.Author: Sue-Huddersfield
Reviews.Content: All reviews I read stated how small the rooms were. It is true but does it matter? We were barely in it and there was sufficient room for what we needed - it was clean & welcoming. Simone also booked an excellent dinner cruise on the Seine for us - to be recommended. There was the very friendly (except for 1 grumpy waiter) cafe underneath the hotel which is handy for a coffee before a day of touring and a drink prior to an evening out. We had our lunch there on the arrival day and the food was great. A good place to meet up.... The trauma of the otherwise excellent weekend was the misplacing of my passport. The reception staff put me in touch with the British Embassy, pointed me in the right direction for the police station and the internet facilities were invaluable. Then when the passport was finally located a few weeks later (behind the mini bar) they returned it to me very promptly.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: aussiemiss
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this wonderful hotel from 4-8 July. This is an outstanding hotel for a number of reasons. The area is completely safe for singles and families, with shops and an ATM just across the street. The bus nearby travels along the seine into the city and the walk to the eiffel tower is easy and safe day and night. The rooms are very clean, bed is comfortable and if you are staying in summer the airconditioning is fantastic. As other reviews have stated the reception staff are friendly, very helpful and speak english well. Another feature is the free internet in the lobby. This hotel comes highly recommended, and I will not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,comfortable,friendly - Mike/Janice, New Zealand”
Reviews.Author: maoriontour
Reviews.Content: Stayed here mid June 07. Nice place to stay and good value for money. Average size room - clean and comfortable. Front desk reception staff Anis and Simone very friendly and helpful. Free internet. Located on a busy intersection but rooms quiet and no noise. Handy access to buses and trains. Markets across the road one or two days a week. Cafe/bar next door and close to other shops - food, wine, groceries, laundrette,restaurants, etc. Recommend

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: AmberG07
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Paris and decided on this hotel from reading other reviews on this website. We were not dissappointed. The reception we recieved on arrival at the hotel was exceptional. Location was good, only 10 min walk from Eiffel Tower The room was cosy and clean and had a good view. We would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful French hotel”
Reviews.Author: AdmRep
Reviews.Content: I just arrived back from a 2 week trip to London and Paris. While in Paris, my family and I stayed at the Hotel Eiffel Kennedy and would like to recommend it to anyone who is planning a trip there. My daughter works for a large international hotel chain and we could have stayed at one of their properties for a considerable discount. However, I wanted to experience Paris and part of that experience was staying at a French hotel. I discovered the Eiffel Kennedy through TripAdvisor. Dispite my desire to stay at a small French hotel, I was feeling somewhat apprehensive about making a reservation at an unkown entity. I read most of the Eiffel Kennedy's reviews contained on this website (and other sites). I would now have to say, I agree with the positive comments made by all the others of this hotel. The location is out of the hustle and bustle of every day tourists' areas, yet close enough to make them easily accessible (metro and bus line are close by). We bought a 3 day pass for the metro and bus but ended up walking everywhere (used the pass twice). The walk from the hotel to the Eiffel Tower is an easy one. We also easily walked to the Louvre and Notre Dame (we're in relatively good shape but by no means fitness buffs). I will say we slept well each night after all our walking. It's wonderful how the people of Paris "stroll" and seem to take time to enjoy the scenery and there are so many beautiful parts of Paris to enjoy. The staff at the Eiffel Kennedy was welcoming and friendly. Simone gave us great tips concerning transportation, safety measures, sights to see, etc. The rooms were European small (larger than I prepared myself for) and very clean and comfortable. Our bathroom was large. The breakfast is not to be missed. When you compare its cost to the dining costs in Paris, it is a great deal and very good. My husband was so-o-o pleased to get a large cup of American coffee. I loved the quiche! If we ever get back to Paris, the Hotel Eiffel Kennedy will definitely be the place we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tired_travelling_dad
Reviews.Content: Visiting Paris for Conference at nearby hotel / conference centre. Very well located hotel for the Eiffel Tower and the river, although about 10 minute walk to Metro. Rooms are small but very well appointed and clean and more than adequate for a visit to Paris. Hotel is well maintained and the service is very good from the moment you enter the hotel to checkout at the end of your stay. The staff are incredibly helpful. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: We3luv2travel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little off the beaten path and is fairly quiet, which is good for trying to sleep at night in such an incredibly noisy city. You can catch a bus (forgot the number, but the hotel will tell you) just a couple blocks away and within minutes it will take you to the center of everything. It was the BEST way to get around Paris. The hotel was very clean, our room was not real roomy, but plenty big for 3. Our bathroom was very large. There was an air conditioner and a little refrigerator in our room. And this is one of the few older hotels that actually has an elevator, so you don't have to haul your luggage up 3 flights of stairs. The breakfast was okay, but rather expensive for what you get. There is a wonderful bakery directly across the street with amazing pastries and a little restaurant on the corner next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Aprl24
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Hotel Eiffel-Kennedy May 17th-May 23rd and it was so wonderful! The hotel met and exceeded all of our expectations, as did the area it's located in. The room was an average size for European hotels. We were in room 212, in a spacious double bed that was very comfortable, clean and the pillows were great (my sister and I actually both said "These pillows are great!"). There is a desk in the room, and under the desk you will find the outlet :) The room was very clean as well. The drapes kept the light out and the windows kept the noise out (not that there was much noise, the area was pretty quiet for the most part.) It was awesome to look out our window every morning and watch people walking their dogs and parents walking their children to school, and then gaze out the window at the Eiffel Tower at night. There was an individual air-conditioner in the room that worked great. Just keep in mind it works on Celcius! The TV got CNN and a few French channels. The bathroom was very clean. I'm VERY picky about bathrooms and this one was very good. There was a little pipe leakage behind the toilet, but only water. We loved our room too much to say anything, and it was not a big deal at all. The shower had really great water pressure and you could take a bath if you wanted. It wasn't cramped at all. The hair dryer works - it looks old, and it doesn't have the air pressure that our American blow dryers have, but it gets the job done. The walls were a little thin, but that's like every other hotel in France and probably Europe. The staff was very pleasant and accommodating. They bid us Bon Jour, Bon Journee, Bon Soir and Bon Nuit whenever we saw them, and were very nice to chat with. When our voltage converter broke and we asked where they could be purchased, the staff brought out a box and tested our products with their own voltage converters until they found one that worked! They let us use it for the rest of the trip free of charge. There is free internet on a computer in the lobby. And free Wi-fi access in the hotel rooms. The elevator will hold two people with some bags, or one person with large luggage. Under the hotel is Cafe a la Fontaine, it's open until 11:30 (23:30) at night. Their food was really delicious and the staff was very accommodating. Prices were good too. Also under the hotel is a liquor store and a Tabac. Across the street is a Bakery (with DELICIOUS chocolate croissants), Butcher, Pharmacy, Convenience Store (open late late late too), ATM, Asian restaurant, and two days a week there is a Market. Down the block a little is the Post Office and a small grocery store. You have everything you need right there! The area is quiet and charming. It is only a 5 minute walk to the RER station Pdt du Kennedy, and a 10 minute walk to the nearest Metro station Ranelagh. If you walk about 20 minutes up Rue Raynouard to Rue Passy, you will find a Monoprix and Passy Plaza - an indoor mall with a grocery store, Gap, H&M, and Zara among other stores. You can also walk to the Eiffel Tower from the hotel! It takes about 25 minutes - but it's a REALLY REALLY pleasant walk. Take the Allee des Cygnes (Alley of Swans) island on the Seine - which is a pedestrian area - to Pont Bir Hakeim. Cross the street to a lovely rose garden walkway that takes you right to the Eiffel Tower. Also - if you go this way, the restaurant Iolanda at Bir Hakeim is terrific. Ask for Khalit or Mario. They were wonderful. The house Lasagna is the best I've ever had - and my dad is a chef! The creme brulee was pretty incredible too, and the prices were REALLY great. I absolutely adored this hotel. My sister and I miss "our" neighborhood and can't wait to return. I will stay here again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: wizzerd
Reviews.Content: We just cam eback from Paris a few days ago. Stayed one night at Eiffel Kennedy on the 22 May. Was greeted by a very warm hospitality by the lady at the reception. Spoke good English. THe room was very pleasant, facing the busy street but hardly noise can be heard inside. Was impressed by the bathroom cum toilet was spanking clean, its standard can match any 5 star hotel. Downside was there was no kettle and iron in the room, and one of the reception staff ( middle-aged man) doing the night shift was a little stuck up. Pulled a sour face when we asked for some hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, extrodinary staff!”
Reviews.Author: Passtraveler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Eifflel - a charming (small) wonderful hotel in a quite residential area. What made it so wonderful was the warm welcome by your hosts Bernard and Simone. All the staff was warm, friendly and welcoming! You are greeted back at your room each day with your keys handed to you without even having to say your name or room number! They remember your name from check in to check out.l Delightful. As with all european hotels in this price range - the rooms were small - but fitted with everything you need, including minifridge - and spotless!. As we did not spend any time in the room other than to sleep, space was never an issue. If you have travelled abroad you will know that "little" is the norm and if you expect nothing more than the size of a large ocean liner cabin - you will never be dissappointed. While not extremely close to the Metro or RER ( 5 - 10 min walk) - the quiet location was a haven to come home to after a busy day sightseeing and shopping in the hustle and bustle of the city center. We were out walking the streets after midnight many times and never felt uncomfortable at all (3 women) The location was near a local market, bakery, cafe, street market on Fridays and a short walk to a Monoprix dept. store. Great location. All of paris is easily accessable by the RER and Metro - You can be in the heart of the Champs Elysees three metro stops later - stay on the same line and you will be to the Eiffel Tower in minutes. Having travelled western europe quite a bit the last 3 years and this being my 4th visit to Paris, this was by far, the friendliest most welcoming hotel I have ever stayed. What the Eiffel lacked in room space it certain exceeded in hospitality and cleanliness! A gem!

Reviews.Title: “Typically French”
Reviews.Author: FrettingPete
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Eiffel Kennedy is a little gem! It is off the well-known tourist path and is all the better for it. The area around the hotel is mainly made up of apartment buildings - some of which look quite expensive! There are small supermarkets, a boulangerie, a wine shop and plenty of cafes and bars within a two minute stroll. For a special night out try 'Restaurant Chaumette'. Beautiful food and fine wine. There is a bar/cafe beneath the hotel which is open until late. The hotel itself is small, as are the rooms, but beautifully kept and with friendly staff. The Bois de Boulogne and the Eiffel Tower are a pleasant 30 minute stroll away and the Allee des Cygnes (a narrow island in the middle of the Seine) is a very pleasant way to walk to the Eiffel Tower. The nearest Metro is Ranelagh (about 10 minutes away) and the RER line to Versailles (Javel station) is around 15 minutes walk. The breakfast room is in the basement and, as it is small, there can be a queue at times. However, Madame makes most of the breakfast fare herself and it is both plentiful and delicious. There is free internet access in the lobby and the reception staff (who all speak English) can book numerous excursions, etc. from the front desk. The Eiffel Kennedy is well worth considering for a real taste of France.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: blath
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a business colleague for one night in a twin room. Room comfortable, very clean and adequately fitted out. Good size bathroom with all the usual. Very good breakfast with a willingness to offer alternatives to the wide selection available. My colleague is coeliac and with no prior warning a fresh breakfast was cooked fror him. Staff very friendly and helpful and recommended a very good local restaurant - Bo-Zinc Cafe on Avenue Mozart where the food, ambience and staff were all very nice and provided good value. Location is good, near metro and with a healthy walking distance of the Eiffel tower. Happy to recommend for short stay on budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: a_stevenson
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend break in Paris, staying at the Eiffel-Kennedy. We got a good deal through Expedia - approx. 530 euros for 3 nights including a great breakfast each morning. Our room was small (not too small) and had air-conditioning, mini bar and a good-sized bathroom. Despite not 'phoning in advance to check, we were able to check in early on the first day. The hotel is located in quite a quiet area near the Sienne about a 20 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower. A few restaurants & small shops nearby, but if you want more nightlife then you would need to venture further into the city centre (using the excellent Metro). The hotel's main plus point for us was the extremely friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here...”
Reviews.Author: Franceens
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed at this hotel for three nights in April. This was the worst experience we ever had. We were put in a hotel room with a window facing on to a wall - no natural light whatsoever. There was a stale smell in the room and the toilet was the smallest one we had ever seen - only room for 1 person at a time. The room itself was also very small. When we complained, we were informed that nothing could be done as the hotel was completely full at the time. I would never ever stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in paris in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Chris_from_CH
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Hotel Eiffel Kennedy March 31-April 3....only positive comments about our experience. The hotel is in the 16th Arrondisment in a quiet neighborhood-- easily reachable by Metro (we reached Paris by train from Switzerland -- took metro from Gare de Lyon to La Muette). Not sure of the exact number of rooms, but it is definitely is smaller hotel. If you are looking for a 3 star hotel that is clean, well-run and staffed by very friendly, helpful people, this is the place for you. Reception staff was outstanding -- they handled our numerous questions with a smile and all of their recommendations for restaurants and attractions were great. All spoke English well. Rooms - we booked rooms 321-322....2 separate rooms that can be converted into a suite with a separate, lockable door (door stays open if rooms booked separately)....you could even see the top of the Eiffel from both rooms. This worked perfectly for our 4 person family (2 adults, and kids aged 10 & 12). Rooms are "average size" for Paris (i.e., on the small size), but are well-kept and very clean. Food: There are many good restaurants in the neighborhhood, covering all price ranges and types of food. Breakfast is available at the hotel - for a family with kids it is perfect due to the convenience and buffet style - omelettes, wide selection of breads and cakes, fruit, juices, coffee, hot chocolate. The woman who manages the breakfast "cafÃ©" is extremely nice and always made sure that we had everything we needed. For groceries - there is a full grocery store across the street; there are also smaller markets within a 2 minute radius that are open until 11-midnight....and also on Sundays. Various tourist areas aloing the Seine (Eiffel/Louvre/Point Neuf/Notre Dame) easily reachable via Metro or via bus line #72, which runs every 10-15 minutes (you can use same tickets as /pass as Metro). We used this bus several times.....drivers must be used to tourists...all were very patient, helpful and friendly. Eiffel is about a 15 minute walk away at a moderate pace - very nice walk down the AlleÃ© de Cygnes (island in the middle of the Seine) to the Eiffel. There is also a taxi stand a 3 minute walk away. We really liked this hotel for the cozy feel, good logistics and great value for the money - we will certainly be back!

Reviews.Title: “"True" Cozy French”
Reviews.Author: orchid4sue
Reviews.Content: As a business manager for luxury hotels, what a wonderful, pleasant surprise to experience such a "French" personal touch hotel. Our large party of 10 all received the most warm welcome and assistance, thanks Bernard and staff! After staying at some of the world's finest hotels, this hotel was truly a stay I will remember and revisit. Though the rooms may be petite, the location is superb, I felt truly like I was a local, it was wonderful! I encourage anyone that wishes to experience a true "French" hotel DO book enjoy, eat the home made quiche! Ms. Perry, Dallas, Texas

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home”
Reviews.Author: kainternational
Reviews.Content: From minute one the Eiffel Kennedy people were friendly and acommodating (no pun intended). They ensured that we were looked after at the end of 26 hours travelling, preparing our room ahead of the usual check-in time so that we could rest if we wanted to. They could not do enough for us. Breakfast was a highlight of each day with a range of fresh baguette, quiche, cakes and omelettes with STRONG coffee, all served in a beautifully decorated cellar area. The room was small, as we expected, but was comfortable, having everything we needed to rest : and to recover from our extensive periods of sighseeing. The location was ideal. A short walk to the Eiffel Tower (seen from our window) in one direction and the Boulainvilliers Metro station a short walk in the other. All of Paris is very accessible from here. In fact, almost all of the most obvious sights of Paris are within good walking distance of the hotel. Slightly further up the road from the station is a market street, offering the best of prepared food and fresh. The fruit was great! We recommend this hotel highly, and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: arch1WashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: Super location in the 16th arr. --- 2 blocks from the Seine -- convenient to bus (scenic ride along the Seine to Hotel de Villle); nice neighborhood; lots of children going to school, etc. Hotel was fabulous. The staff was most helpful in recommending restaurants, transportation, near-by places to visit. The rooms are French-efficient. Hotel has free wi-fi in every room -- great for taking my laptop. Patrons are business people, families on vacation, singles, and retirees from all over: USA, Australia, New Zealand, France, Great Britian, etc. For us, the hotel was very accommodating when we needed an extra bed for a few days. The breakfast is one of the best I have ever had. In addition to the usual fare, the madame bakes various fruit tarts, quiches, breads. Wow!!! The evening/weekend staff and the maids were most polite and efficient. This is as close to a "Bed and Breakfast" as one can get!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: steveh6282
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Hotel Eiffel-Kennedy this March. We highly recommend the hotel. Our room was normal-sized for Paris. The room was well-designed to take full advantage of the space. Our room was over a busy street, but with the windows closed we rarely heard any noise from outside. The windows must be some kind of special triple-glazed windows designed to inhibit noise. We brought our laptop, and after putting in the hotel password, we were up 24/7 for the rest of our stay, with no interruptions. The breakfasts are the highlight. The food keeps coming, freshly baked and in a great variety. I was partial to the fresh plum tarts and the fresh pear tarts. The coffee they use is very tasty, and is a special blend available only to French restaurants. The staff was uniformly knowledgeable and pleasant, and gave us several good ideas for travel in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here, it's great!”
Reviews.Author: jlschlesi
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Europe, and loved our stay at the Hotel Eiffel Kennedy the most out of all of our stops! The hotel is adorable and in a great residential quarter so you get the feel for Parisian life more than you would in another hotel. The owner and his staff do a great job of making you feel right at home and speak English well. They are more than willing to give you maps and directions to anything you wish to visit. We were lucky enough to be there on a Friday, and got to experience the open air market (right across the street ) that was fabulous. I loved our stay at this hotel and will definitely stay there when we return. The rooms are well appointed and the breakfast is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “A charming little hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: viaggiera
Reviews.Content: Clean, secure family hotel. Its location is great, in a quiet and nice zone, near the metro and everything you need. The staff is very helpful, all of they try to make your stay incredible, and get all you need. (Tks Simone!!!). The breakfast... wow!! You get enveloped by the parisien charm!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice pleasant hotel!”
Reviews.Author: grindergal
Reviews.Content: My father and I stayed in this hotel from January 8th-January 13th 2007. Upon our arrival we were both weary from the travel, but excited about going out and seeing the sights. I had been souring my travel books for months and had created (or so I thought) the perfect itinerary. Upon arrival, we were greeted with a smile. Although I studied french for a year before the trip and had 3 years previous experience in highschool french class, my french was horrible and slow. It really is hard to try and communicate thoughts quickly in a foreign language. I have a new found respect for those who speak multiple languages. The owner who checked us in was very patient and nice. He showed us a map of the area and pointed out interesting spots. We went up to our rooms (316 &316) which were right next to eachother. The Rooms: Clean yet dated. The room is small and smells of smoke, but has a certain je ne sais pas quois? It is cute. I also liked that we could open our windows to see and hear a busy, bustling Paris, and then shut them again to complete silence. The bed looked like it was going to be awful, but it was actually very comfy. Girls, watch out, the hairdryer provided is probably 30 years old. It is quite the contraption, but it gets the job done. I also could not find any outlets to plug my ipod or other electronics into, I did bring a converter. The tv has one station in english, but I could kind of make-out the dialogue on the early morning cartoons. When you leave the hotel, you leave the key at the door with whoever is at the desk. If you get back late to the hotel you have to ring the bell and eventually a sleepy attendant will let you in. The Food: When booking through BA Holidays, the breakfast buffet is included. I would not pay the 10 euros they charge otherwise. It is not really a full breakfast, more continental fare. But still delicious. When I would get ready in the morning, I would see the owner run accross the street to the local bakery for a baguette to bring to the buffet, bust most of the stuff was homemade. There are restaurants in the area as well as several convenience stores and small markets. Location: Not in the center of everything. You could probably walk to the Eiffel Tower, but it would be quite the trek. Still, the location is close enough to RER (5 mins) and Metro (7 minutes). I personally thought the area was very nice. The main city has lots of graffiti. I liked the residential neighborhoods, and in the morning we watched parents taking their kids to school and walking their dogs. Service: Very nice. Their tends to be some misconception that the French are rude. I have never encountered this. I do however work in retail and experience rude Americans all the time. Anyway, they put up with my "french" and I think that they were pleased that I did at least make some effort. We Americans do tend to expect others to cater to us. Problems: Not really any. The second or third day there, though, we were in the cellar leaving breakfast and the second we pushed the elevator button, the electricity went off. Surely, this is not the fault of management. We were just so glad we were not in the elevator because it really is the smallest thing I have ever encoutered. My dad and I barely fit (and neither of us is huge). We took the stairs the rest of our stay. Overall: Great. There were no problems. The fact that free internet is offered is a nice touch by the management. Location is cheap We got a great deal (Around $100 American including breakfast per room, per night) We were in a safe neighborhood, and the place was kept really clean. Hats off to everyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel/Clean/Affordable”
Reviews.Author: sleeman67
Reviews.Content: Took trip advisor advice and wasn't disappointed! Very friendly and extremely accomadating. This hotel is in a great area which is safe and quiet. Great restaurant about 2 blocks away - just walk toward the Seine River before the bridge and turn right! The best pizza ever! Rooms are quite small but very cozy and couldnt hear traffic at all. Hotel was undergoing some minor renovations ie: painting - but didnt bother our stay. They have internet for free in the lobby and was hardly ever being used! Very helpful for sights and trip planning around Paris. Overall the value at this hotel is next to none. Breakfast was always a great way to start the day and is an extra 10 euros ! Worth it as nothing opens until 11am.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and comfortable, made the break special.”
Reviews.Author: PinguLondon
Reviews.Content: My friend and I treated our daughters to a surprise trip to Paris. On our arrival we were welcomed and given maps and points of interest that we may have wished to visit. The hotel had a fantastic postion for all the famous sites and the staff were extremly helpful in directing us to bus stops or metro stations. It was like staying with a family member, we were treated with respect at all times and felt so relaxed and at home. The breakfast was beautifully served. The room was clean and the food offered was fresh, with good a selection. I would definately stay here again and recomend it to any one travelling to Paris. Thank you for making our stay so comfortable and easy, as women travelling abroad can be daunting, however we thoroughly relaxed and loved every minute.

HotelInfo.Name: Eiffel - Kennedy Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 12, rue de Boulainvilliers | 16 Arr., 75016 Paris, France
